Maria Felisa is 30 years old. She is single and lives in the municipality of Sololá, which is part of the Department of Sololá. She makes a living buying and selling traditional clothes. 

She sells from her home, and during village market days she goes out to sell, since many people do not have the means to reach the municipality for their shopping.  She takes the opportunity to negotiate her sales. Her mother was previously in charge of the business. She and her mother started the business ten years ago.

Maria Felisa needs a loan of 7,000 Q [quetzals] to buy more merchandise. She comments that, the better the assortment, the higher the income and she attracts more clients. She dreams of having a larger and much better stocked business.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothes.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is a businesswoman from Aloran. She runs a sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. She is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

Now she is applying for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Matilde continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Shekina Group

texts.en:
Hilda is a businesswoman and a mother of four children, two grown-up and two schooling. She is divorced and runs a mamalishe business serving breakfast, including tea with bites, lunch and supper, a business she has been with for 10 years. A mamalishe is a low-class restaurant commonly used by low-class people, and she depends on this to raise the family income. Hilda learned this business herself since is not difficult, just as with home cooking. She is a very hardworking mother taking care of her family. 

She desires to make her business better, cooking more varieties of food that looks attractive to users. She starts serving people from 6 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

Hilda, together with her group members, requests a loan to be apportioned among Shekina group, which has 24 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.  

Hilda will use her portion to replenish food stock of rice, beans, sugar, vegetables, soft drinks and buckets of cooking oil. She desires to grow her business portfolio by opening a Mpesa to become an agent of the money transfer network.

loans.use: to replenish food stock of rice, beans, sugar, vegetables, soft drinks and buckets of cooking oil.

loans.name: Joventina

texts.en:
Joventina, 58-years-old, lives in  Aloran, Misamis Occidental with her family. Her husband is a meager earner, that's why she helps the family with having a store to make a big help with their needs. 

She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which supported her with the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store. She became a Member in Good Standing, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she applies for 15,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: El Nazareno Group

texts.es: Doña Bernardina, tiene 58 años de edad,  esta casada, tiene 9 hijos, reside en el municipio de Intibucá junto a su esposo y 6 de sus hijos. Lleva 10 años que se dedica a cultivar papas, brócoli y repollo, esta actividad  la realiza con su familia y ha sido la fuente de ingresos. Ella ha solicitado seis préstamos con el actual que es por 5,000 lempiras, y es en forma grupal. Piensa invertir en la compra de abono y semillas de papas para sembrar, con el propósito de poderle dar asistencia y ampliar el cultivo. Su fin es obtener ganancias para darles educación a sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de vida. El grupo se denomina El Nazareno, integrado por seis personas, que se dedican al cultivo de papas y hortalizas y residen en la misma zona. El monto de préstamo grupal es por 32,500 lempiras y lo utilizaran en la compra de abonos y semillas de papas para la siembra. En la foto esta Maria Nery, Aneyda y Danilo a la derecha, al frente esta Eusebia a la izquierda, Sabina y doña Bernardina a la derecha.
texts.en:
Doña Bernardina is 58 years old, married and has 9 children.  She lives in the municipality of Intibucá, together with her husband and 6 of her children.  She has been working for 10 years growing potatoes, broccoli and cabbage.  She does this with her family and it has been the source of her income.  She has requested six loans including the current one that is for 5,000 lempiras (HNL) and it is in a group loan.  She is planning to invest in the purchase of fertilizer and seed potatoes to plant with the purpose of being able to provide assistance and expand her crops.  Her goal is to obtain earnings to give her children an education and improve their living conditions. 

The group is called “El Nazareno” and is made up of six people who work in cultivating potatoes and vegetables and live in the same area.  The total amount of the group loan is for 32,500 lempiras and they will use it in the purchase of fertilizer and seed potatoes to plant.  In the photo are Maria Nery, Aneyda and Danilo in the back on the right, at the front are Eusebia on the left, Sabina and Doña Bernardina on the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed potatoes to cultívate.

loans.name: Oscar Ernesto

texts.es:
Oscar de 21 años de edad, estudio educación media,  esta soltero y esta conviviendo con una hermana la cual tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas y su mamá se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar.

 Oscar se dedica aprestar servicio como corralero tiene 4 años de laborar en un  establo, el cual entro como ayudante y se gano la confianza y paso hacer el encargado, ademas cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz en sus ratos libres, ya que solo trabaja 3 horas en la mañana y 3por la tarde de lunes a domingo.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar maíz, leña, para la venta de tortillas y mejorara el local donde elabora las tortillas su  hermana.


Sus sueños y proyecciones son pues mejorar su vivienda y comprarse unas vacas para tener su propio establo  y hacer un cultivo de maíz para tener alimentación para la familia y que Dios le de salud para seguir trabajando para que esto se le haga realidad y gracias a los créditos espera lograrlos.
texts.en:
Oscar, age 21, studied media education. He is single and lives with a sister, who has a tortilla business, as well as with his mother, who does the housework.
Oscar provides cooper services and has been working in a stable for four years. He started off as a helper and gained people's confidence, which is how he got to be in charge. He also cultivates 7,000 square metres of corn in his spare time, since he only works three hours in the morning and three in the afternoon Mondays to Sundays.
He is requesting this loan for the purchase of corn and firewood for the sale of tortillas, and to improve the area where his sister makes tortillas.
His dreams and projections for the future are to improve his home and to buy some cows in order to have his own stable and to cultivate corn in order to feed his family. He hopes that God will give him health in order to continue working so that this can become a reality, and he thanks the lenders he hopes to find.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for the sale of tortillas, and to improve the space where his sister makes tortillas.

loans.name: Euden  Gilberto

texts.es:
Euden Gilberto tiene 22 años de edad, reside en el Distrito de Buenos Aires, desde hace 6 años, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al corte de leña, también se desempeña ofreciendo el servicio de carga, es un joven emprendedor, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de madera para abastecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Euden Gilberto  is 22 and has lived in the Buenos Aires district for six years. This is a community with a hot climate. The population works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. The community is located in the Morropon province, belonging to the Piura region, on the north coast of Peru.
Euden Gilberto works as a woodcutter. He also offers a transportation service. He is a young entrepreneur and has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of wood to supply to his clients. This way, he will generate a greater income for his family.

loans.use: to buy wood to sell.

loans.name: Candida Natalia

texts.es: Cándida, tiene 61 años de edad, vive en unión libre junto a su esposo y reside en un sector del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella hace 5 años decidió por tener su propio negocio donde vende ropa de segunda mano para damas caballeros y niños, esta actividad la tiene en su casa y es su fuente de ingresos familiar. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar fardos de ropa usada para vender como camisas, vestidos, blusas, pantalones, short y ropa de niño, teniendo variedad espera aumentar las ventas y sus ganancias. Su plan es tener bien establecido y grande su negocio.
texts.en: Cándida is 61 years old and lives with her husband. They live in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. She has been running her own business for 5 years in which she sells second hand clothes for men, women and children. She runs her business from her home and it is a source of income for her family. She is asking for a loan of $975 so she can purchase more used clothing like shirts, dresses, blouses, pants, shorts and children's clothing. She would like to have a greater variety of merchandise to sell so that she can earn more. Her plan is to stabilize and grow her business.

loans.use: purchases used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is requesting your financial help again, this time for medical help. He hasn't been feeling well lately and was referred to some health specialist in the capital city.

Vladimir is very thankful to you all for the previous help and promises that he will pay this loan within the time-frame required.

loans.use: to pay for his medical visitation

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en: Abubakar is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Abubakar joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Nasiru, Nazifi, and  Suwaiba,. Abubakar is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Abubakar will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Abubakar can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to build a better home.” Abubakar is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “make more money for myself and my family”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is  taking a loan of $600 to improve her business.  She is married and has six children.  She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as  oils, water, candles, noodles, coffee, sugar, and rice.  She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $500.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy oils, water, candles, noodles, coffee, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is  taking a loan of $ 600.00 to improve her business. She is running a second-hand  that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy shirts with long sleeves and short sleeves, long pants, and shorts.

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 300.00.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy shirts with long sleeves and short sleeves, long pants, and shorts

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika works hard from early morning to earn a living and provide her two children with all necessary things. She is divorced. She is the only feeder and keeper of her two children. 

She began her own business of selling food items five years ago. Malika sells food items in a shop which is located near her living house. She renews the assortment of her goods four or five times in a month. She manages the business alone. 

Malika is going to repair her shop and also some of her rooms and in this way to make better the business conditions. She is asking for a loan of 7500 TJS to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paint, etc. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, paint, etc.

loans.name: Parachichi Group

texts.en:
Amina, in her thirties, is married and has three children, one very young and the other two in school. She has been managing a restaurant serving food such as breakfast, lunch and soft drinks. She has run this business for seven years now and is able to make a good profit each month. Amina opens her business from 6am to 4pm daily. 

She is requesting for a third loan via Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous credit, since she repaid, to buy restaurant food stock, business fridge and soft drinks. She earned an extra income which she used to pay school fees and household expenses. In the coming years, Amina would like to build a house and own a family car. With her new request, she will buy a dryer for her new beauty salon. She is so thankful with everyone who will support her group.

Amina,together with other six members (Parachichi group) will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a dryer for her new beauty salon.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en: Matilde is a businesswoman from Oroquieta. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 21 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed loans previously to purchase for additional stocks and now she is re-applying a loan for her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en: Rodolfo is 26 years old, married and had two children. He is a tricycle driver at their village and provides transport services. He has been in his business for two years now. Rodolfo is now asking for a loan of P5,000 use in his business. He will buy gasoline and crude oil for the motorcycle. It will help maintain his business and keep providing safe travel for all his passengers.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and crude oil for his motorcycle transport

loans.name: Sabrina Yamileth

texts.es:
Sabrina estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada y madre de dos hijos,  su esposo trabaja como seguridad, sus hijos vive junto con ellos y la actividad que ella realiza es la agricultura y a la venta de cosméticos por revistas es de donde tiene ingresos para ella y su hijos.

Sabrina se dedica a la agricultura,  actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años por lo que tiene mucha experiencia en dicha actividad la cual aprendió de sus padres dado al índice de pobreza de sus padres no pudo estudiar, por lo tanto no pudo optar a otra actividad por lo que tuvo que dedicarse a la agricultura junto a sus padres actividad que realizan a pocos metros de su casa, además los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de pupusas.
                                  
El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar semilla, abono y otros insumos para su cultivo de maíz, espera que gracias al crédito podrá tener una mejor producción en su cosecha y mejores ingresos a su familia y poder cancelar el crédito con la ganancia cubrir algunos gastos de su familia 
    
Sabrina manifestó que sus sueños son tener una vivienda digna y poderle dar la educación que ella no tuvo a su pequeños hijos, quiera que Dios le de vida y salud para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Sabrina has a sixth grade education, is married, and has two children.  Her husband works as a security guard.  Their children live with them.  Sabrina is a farmer and also sells cosmetics via catalog.  This is how she gets income for herself and her children.

She has been farming for ten years and has lots of experience. She learned from her parents and was not able to attend school, given their level of poverty.  She was not able to choose another business activity because she had to work in agriculture with her parents.  They work a few meters from her house,  and she sells ‘pupusas’ [stuffed tortillas] on the weekends.

She is asking for this loan to buy seeds, compost, and other supplies for growing corn. She hopes that this loan will allow her to have better production and income for her family.  This is so that she will be able to repay the loan with the income and cover some family expenses.

Sabrina says that her dreams are to have a decent house and to be able to give the education that she did not have to her young children.  She wants God to give her life and health to be able to achieve that.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and other supplies for her corn crop.

loans.name: Jenivah

texts.en: Jenivah finds pleasure in doing her farming activities. She is so keen in every detail of her farming business. Jenivah grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her chosen business. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizers. In the future, she wishes to become the supplier of rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Chuisajcab Group

texts.es: Francisco tiene 58 años de edad (aparece de primero en la fila, de izquierda a derecha, viste playera blanca y pantalón verde) Francisco solicita nuevamente crédito porque con el crédito anterior le fue muy bien en la cosecha y con ello aseguró  la alimentación de su familia durante todo el año, cuando no tenia crédito solo cultivaba una pequeña cantidad por no le alcanza su capital, Francisco necesita un crédito para el mantenimiento (compra de abono químico y pago de jornales para limpia)  de maíz, el préstamo le ha cambiado la vida por ya no se preocupa tanto por la alimentación de la familia y lo que le sobra saca al mercado para obtener un ingreso más, el sueño de Francisco es tener más conocimiento para el manejo técnico del cultivo de maíz
texts.en: Francisco is 58 years old (he is the first in line from left to right and is wearing a white shirt and green pants). Francisco is asking for a new loan because his previous loan went very well and helped him with the harvest and he was able to feed his family for the whole year. Before he got the loan, he only cultivated a small amount of crops and it was not enough to sell. He needs a new loan so he can maintain his corn crop (with fertilizer and to pay for labor). The previous loan changed his life because he no longer had to worry about feeding his family and with anything left over goes to the market to sell his produce and earns a little extra money. His dream is to have more knowledge about how to cultivate his crops.

loans.use: purchase supplies to grow corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's surgery

loans.name: Lazaro Ramon

texts.es: Lázaro Ramón: Es un joven alegre y sociable de 29 años de edad, originario de Rosita, soltero, tiene 3 hijos, el mayor de 12 años estudia su segundo año de secundaria y dos menores de edad. Es locutor de radio. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda, solicita su segundo financiamiento para mejorar la infraestructura de la letrina y de la cocina. Su sueño es instalarle cerámica a su vivienda de minifalda de concreto y madera.
texts.en: Lázaro Ramón is a happy and sociable young man of 29. He is originally from Rosita, he is single and has 3 children. His oldest is 12 years old and is in his second year of secondary school. The other two children are much younger. Lazaro is a radio host. His goal is to improve his home and he is asking for a second loan in order to improve the infrastructure of the bathroom and the kitchen. His dream is to install tiles in his home and put in a foundation of concrete and wood.

loans.use: improve the infrastructure of his home.

loans.name: Isiyaku Mallam

texts.en: Isiyaku Mallam remembers feeling depressed  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Isiyaku Mallam, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Isiyaku Mallam  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Isiyaku Mallam   With this loan, Isiyaku Mallam is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Wonderful lenders, meet Florence! She is a 41-year-old mother who is caring, loving and very hardworking. Florence is a mother of two beautiful children and she hails from the Kitale area of Kenya, an area that has one of the best weather patterns in the world and favors dairy and crop farming. 

Florence was raised in a very humble background, and this made her work extra hard so that she would get out of the poverty levels that she was facing. Florence was taught to be hardworking by her parents, and this has really helped her because she has been practicing farming for the past three years, and through farming, she has taken care of her family. Although she has been making profits, life has not been that easy, and due to increased living conditions, Florence started dairy farming. The business has really picked up, and she is now seeing “light at the end of the tunnel.” Because of this reason, Florence wants to buy more dairy cows; that is why she is seeking a loan of 31,200 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy a dairy cow. 

Through the loan, Florence is sure that she will be able to fully utilize the space in her farm and also satisfy the demand for milk in her area, which is very high. Profits from selling the milk will be used in improving her living conditions and providing a solid education system to her children. The dairy cow will also provide manure that will be used in her farm to increase productivity.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Leona

texts.en: Leona lives at Tuguegarao with her family. She is 48 years old, married and had five children. She is in the direct-selling business selling coffee, tea and herbal medicine products. She gets her income in selling this products. Now, she has recruited many costumers that is why she needs additional capital of P5,000 to buy more coffee and herbal medicine to sell. She hopes this loan will be given to her as improvement of her sales and profits as well.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Balbina

texts.en:
Balbina ia applying for a loan of $600.00 to improve her business. She is married and has two children. This is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as a refrigerator, sagiko, Sprite, water, biscuits and Coca-Cola. 

Balbina opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $500.00. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and various drinks and snacks to sell

loans.name: Kawe Enterpreneur Group

texts.en:
Nipael is aged in her thirties and has one schooling kid. She is not married and for eight years now, she has been running a shop, selling food such as rice, sugar, beans, maize flour, baking flour, soft drinks, etc. She starts her shop from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first loan request, which she will use to buy shop stock such as rice, beans, soft drinks and sugar. She dreams to become a successful woman selling rice on a wholesale basis.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "KAWE ENTERPRENEUR," which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy shop stock such as rice, beans, soft drinks and sugar.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, is aged 47, married to a farmer and blessed with four children. She has owned and managed a vegetable stall at the public market for almost twenty years and earns a net income of PHP 1,000 daily. Her net income on this business usually spent on their daily expenditures and school allowances of their children. Due to insufficient fund she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to purchase additional carrots, string beans, potatoes, red bell peppers, and cabbage to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase additional carrots, string beans, potatoes, red bell peppers, and cabbage to sell.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en: Gulshan is smart woman. She is 21 years old. Gulshan is married but does not have children. Gulshan lives with her family in a rural area. She began her own business with animal husbandry one year ago. Gulshan little by little develops her business. She has good opportunity to develop business as she lives in an agricultural area. Gulshan has additional income from growing maize. She grows maize in a 0.50 ha land. Gulshan’s husband and mother-in-law help her with managing business. These businesses are the main of family income. She is going to increase working capital and maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing working capital

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita  lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur together with her family. She owns and operates a food and groceries vending business to earn a living. She has been able to sustain her business for seven years and successfully repaid her previous loan used for purchasing goods to sell. To offer more variety of goods, she took  a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to improve her living situation and wants to see her children's success.b

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Abelita

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Abelita to improve her business. She is married, and she has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as oils, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milks, coffee and shampoo. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2013. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Abelita independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy oils, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milks, coffee and shampoo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for his painting profession

loans.name: Brahian

texts.es:
El Sr. Brahian estudia Derecho, está en su primer año , el vive con su madre y le ayuda en su negocio  , gracias a su trabajo puede estudiar la carrera que le gusta,  es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia , aspira a ser un buen profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de universidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Brahian studies law. He is in his first year. He lives with his mother and helps her with her business. Thanks to her work, he can study the field that he likes. He is a very responsible person who is dedicated to his studies and his families. He aspires to work professionally, continue studying, and help people. He is asking for this loan, so he can use it to pay university fees and continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Encarnación, vive con sus padres, es soltera, actualmente está estudiando la carera de contabilidad, su principal sueño es de terminar su carrera y trabajar en forma independiente.
Ella es una estudiante sacrificada que está luchando por poder cumplir sus metas y anhelos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de título, ya que así podrá seguir con sus sueños.
texts.en: Maria is from the city of  Encarnación. She lives with her parents, is single, and is currently studying accounting. Her biggest dream is to finish her degree and work independently.  She is a dedicated student who is striving to reach her goals and dreams. She is asking for this loan in order to pay university fees, so she can continue working towards her goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Vicente: Es un señor amable, casado, tiene 5 hijos en edad escolar. Trabaja como albañil y vigilante. Su esposa es ama de casa. Con el propósito de vivir de manera digna y segura. Solicita financiamiento para construir su baño y pozo séptico. Desde hace 4 meses con esfuerzo y poco a poco ha construido su vivienda de minifalda de concreto y madera. Su sueño es apoyar a sus hijas a que construyan sus propias viviendas.
texts.en: Vicente is a nice man. He is married with 5 school-aged children. He works as a mason and watchman. His wife is a housewife. With the goal of living in a dignified and safe manner, he is applying for a loan to construct a bathroom and septic tank. For 4 months, he has been constructing his home from concrete and wood. His dream is to support his daughters who are constructing their own homes.

loans.use: to construct a bathroom and a septic tank.

loans.name: Lilet

texts.en:
Lilet lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, with her family. To make a living, she sells fish, while her husband does fishing. She has had her business for more than four years, and she earns better income for the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for purchasing equipment like hooks and nets. With her generated revenue, she started up a transportation business. It earns additional cash inflow, for the family.

She took a new loan recently, to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business, to improve the general living of the entire family.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle used in the transport business

loans.name: Jade

texts.en: Jade is studying at EMCOTECH (Eastern Mindanao College of Technology) taking automotive. In his simple way of living, he wants to have a stable job in the future. Jade had joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to pay school tuition fee for the 1st semester. He is hoping to improve his life after he gains a better job in the future. Jade wants to support his family to ensure better living to the entire family.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fee for the 1st semester

loans.name: Lelibeth

texts.en: Lelibeth is studying automotive at Yllana Bay View College. She had two children and lives in Zamboanga del Sur. She wants to finish her course in order to have a better job in the near future. Along the way, she had her dreams that someday, she will be able to provide better education to her children. She joined GDMPC and she gains access to micro finance services. She borrowed a new loan to pay her tuition fees. She is thankful to GDMPC in helping them and giving the opportunity to improve lives.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Herlyn

texts.en:
Herlyn continues to pursue her masters degree in education, seeking to garner better education and opportunities. Her income from employment helps her family a lot. She has been able to provide her family a better living and education.

She joined GDMPC micro credit to pay her masters degree tuition. Herlyn is hoping to make improvements on her career, and secure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to pay her masters degree tuition

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 56 year old married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest and hardworking. She operates a retail shop where she sells bins and utensils. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation in stocks. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock of utensils. Her business goal is to grow the business within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of utensils

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en: Marwa is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be honest and transparent. He operates a general store where he sells a variety of goods. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock of goods for the expansion of his store. His business goal is to have a bigger store within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of goods for the expansion of his store

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be vigorous. She operates a sewing shop where she sells textiles and clothing. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be not having sufficient stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock of materials. Her business goal is to have a bigger business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of materials for her sewing shop

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta lives in the village Lernadzor in Syunik region. She is a widow and now she lives alone. Marieta has two children; her daughter is married and she lives with her family, and her son now passes his military service at the army.  Marieta has no higher education. For several years she worked at the garment factory as a tailor-worker. Now she works at the food market as a saleswoman. Simultaneously with her work Marieta is engaged in agricultural activities. She does all work about her orchard and vegetable garden cutely and with great care. Here each tree and each shrub is watered on time and the farm is always clean. On her land she raises beans, corn, and many bright and beautiful sunflowers. She has fruit trees; apricot, apple, peach, pear and plum.  All these harvests she sells to re-sellers. 
Marieta greatly hopes to have this loan in order to fence the open part of her garden and to make repairs to the existing fencing.

loans.use: to fence the open part of her garden and to make repairs to the existing fencing.

loans.name: Lirika

texts.en: Lirika wants to thank you all for the previous help. Now she needs your help again to pay for pesticides and other agro services such as the harvesting and plowing of the land.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and pay for other agricultural services

loans.name: Zelia

texts.en: Zelia is taking a loan of $600.00 to improve her business. She is married and she has one child. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock for her store such as biscuits, noodles, fanta, oils, sprite, fish, salt and slippers. She opened her kiosk in 2007 with her own working capital of $200.00. Zelia is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store such as biscuits, noodles, fanta, oils, sprite, fish, salt and slippers

loans.name: Surey

texts.en: Surey is a 43-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase a sewing machine. Her business goal is to own a tailoring school within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new collection of shoes for the Eid

loans.name: Kisese Group

texts.en:
Veronica is a widow, with three children who are still at school. She is in her late 30s. She has been running a cosmetics shop for two years, now. She works from 08:30am to 09:00pm per working day, and she is able to make a very good profit each month.

Veronica is requesting her first loan through Tujijenge Tanzania. This group loan will be apportioned among the five members of Kisese group. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

Veronica will invest her portion to increase her stock of cosmetics, to meet her customers' demand. She desires to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be a fast-thinker. She operates a tailor shop. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to purchase more material. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock of materials so that she may satisfy customers' needs. Her business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of materials for her tailoring shop

loans.name: Om Kosi Group

texts.en:
Om Kosi is a group consists of five women from Sana'a, Yemen. They requested a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB.
Ghania is the leader of the group. She is a 35 years old married woman with four children, living with them in their own house. Their house is very old and it needs renovation. Ghania is the leader of the group. She works as a tailor. From her business, she shares with her husband in the expenses of the family. Her husband is an employee in a private sector. His income is enough to provide his family with a good living, but it is not enough to renovate his old house. For this reason, Ghania applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials as cements, bricks, and iron steel to help her husband in order to renovate their old house.
Ghania looks forward to renovating all of the old house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials as cements, bricks, and iron steel

loans.name: Qamile

texts.en: Qamile has had your financial help in the past and is very appreciative to all of you. Now she needs your help again, this time to repair the leaking roof of her family home. Qamile has been photographed with Ferit, her husband.

loans.use: to repair the leaking roof of her family home

loans.name: Gloria

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 41 anos de idade, solteira mãe de 2 filhos menores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe e 2 sobrinhos que vivem em Namaacha. 
Trabalha na Educação como Docente a mais de 9 anos, aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa e na obra. Com este empréstimo pretende adquirir electrodoméstico como geleira e fogão para sua casa. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo na hluvuku. 
Futuramente pretende concluir o ensino superior e terminar com a sua obra para dar mais conforto a sua família e tem como desafio garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até a faculdade.
texts.en:
Gloria was born in the Namaacha Province in Maputo and is 41 years old. She's a single mother of 2 children who are still minors and both go to school and she is also responsible for her mother and 2 nephews who live in Namaacha.

She has worked in Education as a Teacher for more than 9 years and the money she makes is used for her household expenses and building work on her house. With this loan she intends to buy white goods like a fridge and a stove for her house. This is her 5th loan with Hluvuku.

In future she plans to complete her higher education and finish building her house to provide her family with more comfort. Her biggest challenge is to guarantee her children's education all the way to college.

loans.use: buy white goods like a fridge and a stove for her house

loans.name: Liza

texts.es:
Liza es de la ciudad de Encarnación, ella es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropas. Actualmente está cursando la carrera de Enfermería. 
Su aspiración es culminar su carrera y así seguir enriqueciendo sus conocimientos, para poder ayudar a las personas que necesitan de atención en su salud.
Liza pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus cuotas de universidad y también para poder cubrir sus gastos de manutención. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder estudiar.
texts.en:
Liza comes from the city of Encarnación. She is a shopkeeper and sells all types of clothing. She is currently studying for a nursing degree. Her goal is to finish her degree and thus keep on extending her knowledge so she can help people in need of healthcare.

Liza is asking for this loan to be able to cover her university costs and living expenses. She is grateful for this opportunity to be able to study.

loans.use: to pay for university fees and living expenses.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has two children, whose ages are three years and nine years. She describes herself as ambitious, determined, and committed.

She operates a retail shop, where she sells clothes, towels, shoes, and bags. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are individuals and school children. She says her biggest business challenges are a lack of capital, and dealing with the town council.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock. Her business goal is to grow her business, within five years. She hopes to own a very big business, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Elinette

texts.en: Elinette, is aged 43, married to a private employee and they're blessed with two children. She owns and manages a retail store in their village for almost twenty two years and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. Due to insufficient fund she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase beverages, canned goods, powdered juice, biscuits, noodles, and cooking oil to sell. She's hoping that her business will become more profitable and improve.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, canned goods, powdered juice, biscuits, noodles, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.en:
Bahriniso is the only breadwinner for her three children. Her husband went to Russia some years ago and hasn’t returned to Tajikistan. Bahriniso is a careful mother. She began a sewing business, seven years ago. She offers her service in her house. She also feeds cattle. Bahriniso uses her income to buy clothes and food, and to pay for the education of her children.

She is going to buy feed for cattle, but she has not enough money for it. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy feed for cattle. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy feed for cattle

loans.name: Jacinita

texts.en:
Jacinita finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities to sufficiently provide her family. She is farmer that grows various crops and vegetables. 
She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits to the cooperative her capital in supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied a loan to purchase fertilizers. In the future, Jacinita wishes to become the supplier of vegetables in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 62 years old who finds pleasure in doing her backyard gardening.  She earns well doing this type of work that sufficiently provides for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full fledged member of PMPC. She credits to the cooperative her capital in supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied a loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizers. In the future, Erlinda wishes to open a market stall near their town.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 62 years old who is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her family in Sapang Dalaga and busies herself planting corn and beans.

Editha wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Laling

texts.en: Due to financial hardship, Laling has been engages in making and selling soft brooms within her community. She is 49 years old and has six children. She and her husband aimed to improve their poor status of living in order give their children a better life. With this regard, she aims to strengthen this business so that she will generate sufficient income. Having inadequate capital, she wants to access financial assistance from KIVA lenders through ASKI an amount of PHP10,000.00 to buy more stocks of  tiger grass, rattan and plastics needed in making soft brooms for sale. Being kind and diligent mother, she hopes that someday, she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of  tiger grass, rattan and plastics needed in making soft brooms

loans.name: Bunyige

texts.en: Bunyige is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be hopeful. She operates a general store where she sells a variety of goods. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock of goods. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of goods

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is a 38 year old woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be good. She operates a tailor shop. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase sewing equipment. Her business goal is to be successful  within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase sewing equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his transportation business

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is 39 years old and has two children. She is married and the two children are in school.

Suzette and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Suzette is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9871.40 purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Suzette has been with NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her fish vending business.

With your help, Suzette can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future She would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her food vending business, and now she is requesting a PHP 9,950 housing loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor, so she could build a house for her family. With your help, Teresita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to build a house for her family, to replace the one destroyed by the typhoon

loans.name: Eliso

texts.en: Eliso is 50-year-old married woman from the small village of Zugdidi district. She lives with her husband and two sons. The family has a hectare agricultural land, they grow nut trees and sell the harvest locally. They also have two calves and 100 hens. Eliso is very hardworking woman and she decided to expand the business and to purchase a cow. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1500 Gel. As the cow is purchased, she will start producing dairy products and will sell in her village. Eliso awaits your support to generate more income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wonderful kiva lenders! Meet Wilson 48 years of age very hardworking, honest and humble. He hails from Kitale area of Kenya an area that is “The bread basket of Kenya”. He is blessed with a beautiful wife and 4 adorable children that always paint a smile on his face. Wilson says “my parents taught me to work hard from a young age, and now i am independent”. Through hard work Wilson has been able to take care of his family and always give them the best that he can afford.
Wilson has been doing farming for the past 9 years and through these years he has gathered so much immense wealth of experience that have helped him make profits in his farm. Through mixed farming that is crop and dairy farming Wilson has been able to earn an honest living and always take care of his 4 children.
Kitale area is an area that has a large population and the demand for poultry products and eggs is so high and Wilson being an enterprising person would want to take advantage of that and start a poultry business.
Wilson is seeking a loan of KES 40000 to buy poultry so that he can take full advantage of the already market in Kitale of poultry products and reap more profits. Through profits from poultry farming his children will be assured of a secure future because the best gift that a parent can give his child is education and Wilson will be able to offer that. Wilson believes that if you invest in your child’s education you are providing him with a good background to be able to become someone better in the future.
Wilson projections are that by the end of the year profits gathered will assist him establish a big shop where he will be selling eggs and also poultry meat to both wholesalers and retailers.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Al- Atheer Group

texts.en:
Al- Atheer is a group which consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.
Hanan is the leader of the group. She is a 41 years old married woman with two children. Hanan has a University education, and she works as a teacher in a private school. Hanan's family is not organized in most of days. She has a strong determination to organize the house and to provide her family with better lives. Her house doesn't have enough cupboards. She can't afford that. This makes Hanan feels ashamed, especially when she meets visitors inside the house. Also, the house lacks of more of furniture. For this reason, she requested a loan of 50,000 YER in order to purchase cupboard for the bedroom of the house.
Hanan looks forward to saving account in AMB to make a secure future for her children in the future

loans.use: to purchase cupboard for the bedroom of the house.

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en:
Choeurn, 57 years old, is a construction worker who lives in Baray district, Kampong Thom Province. He is a hard-working farther of five children. His wife, Yal, 59, is a farmer on the cassava farmland. This couple can make a net profit approximately USD 6 a day.

During this time, Choeurn is facing with a financial issue in his family. He needs some money to buy some farming materials for his wife but yet he can’t afford it.  After getting to know that HKL offers KIVA loan with the lower interest rate than its normal loan, he has decided to apply for a KIVA loan to buy fertilizers and others related farming materials for his wife to use in the cassava field. He would like to thank to all lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and others related farming materials

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru: Гулноза вместе со своей семьей живет в отдаленном регионе. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Гулноза 7 лет назад начала свой бизнес животноводством, так как она нуждалась в деньгах. Гулноза откармливает крупно-рогатого скота. Гулноза покупает скот, откармливает несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке. Благодаря опыту и хорошему состоянию скота, она имеет своих постоянных покупателей на местном рынке. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки скота. Этот займ поможет ей увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом развевать бизнес дальше. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulnoza lives with her family in a remote region.  She is married and is raising two children.  Seven years ago, she started her business raising livestock because she needed the money.  Gulnoza raises cattle; she buys the livestock, fattens them up for a few months and resells them at the local market.  Thanks to her experience and the good condition of her livestock, Gulnoza has regular clients at the local market.  She is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy cows.  This loan will help her to increase her working capital and to further increase her business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase her working capital

loans.name: Sabuhi

texts.en: Sabuhi is married and has three children, all of his children are going to school. They live in the Baku region. Sabuhi has a “Kababkhana”. In here he make different types of national food; “Kebab”, “lulekebab”, “tike kebab”, “toyuq kebabi”, etc. Different types of kebab are made of lamb meat, beef, and chicken meat cooked in a brazier. Sabuhi buys all of necessary products from villagers and, of course, these products are totally natural products. Today, Sabuhi wants to buy new fridge, for this reason he needs a loan in amount of 1100 Azerbaijan new manat. He is thankful for the support for the development of business and to the Kiva organization and lenders.

loans.use: pay for buy new fridge

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water cooler for the house

loans.name: Hamdije

texts.en: Hamdije wants to buy a motor cart used for transportation called 'tricycle' in the local language for her son; kindly note that majority of those who owns such a cart are always busy. Hamdije's son is not employed at the moment, and she is certain that this will be a good opportunity for him.

loans.use: To buy a transportation motor cart for her unemployed son

loans.name: Seryozha

texts.en:
Seryozha is 54 years old and he happily lives with his family in the village Lernadzor of Syunik region.  Seryozha works at the Kajaran combine and he also runs a farm. He himself built a barn for his cattle (2 cows), 20 chickens and 12 rabbits. On his plot of land he cultivates beetroot, tomato, cucumber and greens. As Seryozha says the most beloved occupation in his farm is the rabbit breeding. He hopes that in future he will surely enlarge the number of his rabbits and his farm will become famous with this occupation. 
Seryozha has three children 2 daughter and a son. His elder daughter works as a secretary and his second daughter is a salesgirl. Seryozha’s son studies at the Kapan State Architectural College. 
Seryozha asks a loan of 300.000 Armenian drams in order to buy fodder for his rabbits and some part of the loan he will also use to repair his cattle-barn.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his rabbits and to repair his cattle-barn

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a constuction business. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock to expand his business and to improve the services. His business goal is to be successful within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to expand his business and to improve the services

loans.name: Katrina

texts.en:
Katrina is a 51-year-old villager and a married mother of six children. She has three dairy cows and wants to add another one to the existing herd. This loan will help her achieve the goal of expansion for the moment.

Katrina does livestock work; she sells raw milk and baby calves to the locals. She also owns 29 dynym of agricultural land that she has divided into plots -- 12 dynym for planting animal fodder, 4 dynym for corn, 10 dynym for wheat, and the rest for seasonal veggies. She sells fresh agricultural produce. While she does all this work, almost all on her own, her husband works for pay as a night watchman in a nearby telecommunications company.

loans.use: to add another dairy cow to the herd

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 50 years old, married, and lives at Binoongan, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. In order to earn a living she decided to raise pigs and sell them commercially. 

Through Paglaum MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets & feed. Now, she requests a loan of 8000 PHP to purchase pigs and feeds for raising. She really hopes & prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feeds for raising

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en: Romulo is 59 years old, married and lives in Simacolong, Lazi, Siquijor, Philippines. In order to earn a living, he raises pigs. Through Paglaum MPC he obtained the capital to purchase his original piglets and feed. Now he is requesting a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase feed and hogs for raising. He really hopes and prays that his business will grow and benefit his family, in addition to the income of his wife. Someday, he wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed and hogs for raising

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en: Joseline is married with three children and all her children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of a restaurant and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, Irish potatoes and fish.  She sells on a retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked restaurant and also to start practicing outside catering. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO   because of good customer care.  She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and no to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, Irish potatoes and fish

loans.name: Lou

texts.en:
Lou is 35 years old, married, and a resident of Cangmangki, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. She earns a living through ready to wear clothing.

She is a member of PMPC for one  year and six months and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of Php 8,000.00 to purchase different dry goods for buy and sell business.

Lou deeply wishes to maintain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase different dry goods for buy and sell business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia has been running her cafeteria for many years and she earns well for the needs of the entire family.  Currently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare food to sell. She wants to expand to her business and dreams of seeing her children finish their studies in the future

loans.use: to buy additional raw ngredients to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Aiymbubu

texts.ru: Айымбубу 52 года, разведена, мать 3 детей. У Айымбубу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав 4 года назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Айымбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 20 овец и 2 лошади, также есть земельный надел мерою 2,15 ГА, где Айымбубу выращивает эспарцет. Еще одним дополнительным источником дохода  является пошивка одеял и матрасов и их продажа местным жителям. Совокупный ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айымбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота, она хочет продавать молоко, так как на ее продукцию уже есть потенциальные покупатели. Доходы от кредита Айымбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на свадьбы детей.
texts.en: Aiymbubu is 52 years old, divorced and a mother of three children.  She has a high school education and she raises livestock, which is the family's main source of income.  She started this four years ago with the sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work, Aiymbubu now has 20 sheep and two horses, as well as a 2.15 hectare plot of land, on which she grows sainfoin.  As an additional source of income for her family, she sews blankets and mattresses and sells them to the local residents.  Her total monthly income is about 20,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Aiymbubu has turned to Bai-Tushum for a loan of 75,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase her head of livestock.  She wants to sell milk, as she already has potential customers for this.  She plans to use the income from this loan to further increase her head of livestock and she also wants to save up money for her daughter's wedding.

loans.use: To buy dairy cows

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 33-year-old man, who is married to Alice. Together, they have been blessed with seven children, aged between 27 and 10 years. Joseph has been running his retail shop for the last 14 years, and he has a secondary business, practicing both crop and animal farming in his area. He is able to make a monthly income of Kenya shillings 25,000 from both businesses. His wife also contributes to bringing in more income, as she is a businesswoman.

Joseph has requested a fourth loan, which he will use to buy more items in bulk, to add to his retail shop's stock, like flour, margarine, detergent, soap, and tea leaves. He anticipates some profit after this capital boost, and he will save this towards the education of his children. He hopes to have a more fulfilled future.

loans.use: to buy more items in bulk, to add to his retail stock

loans.name: Jairus

texts.en: Jairus is a 26 year old married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 7 years. He describes himself to be committed and ambitious. He operates a general store where he sells cooking fat, shoe polish, soap. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital and dealing with council. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock. His business goal is to grow into a big business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, may use the profit from his business to pay school fees for his children and to buy food. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Izo

texts.en: Izo is 45 years old. She lives in the small village of Tskaltubo district with her husband, son and pensioner mother-in-law. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a cow and two calves. Izo milks the cow every day and produces dairy products. She sells this products in the village as well as use for family foodd. The family owns 0,5 hectare agricultural land, where they want to build a greenhouse. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1500 Gel. With the received credit Izo will purchase all the needed materials to build a greenhouse. As the greenhouse is built, she plans to grow there tomatoes and cucumbers. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family, as their income will be increased and Izo will provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Nozira

texts.en: Nozira is hardworking woman. She is going to start new business because she needs to money. Her husband is a journalist. His salary is not enough to provide family with all necessary things. Nozira brings up a daughter who is 2 years old. Nozira wants to start in business with selling perfumes. She studied at the course ‘To Get Ahead’ from the women organization and got a certificate. She will sell perfumes in a local market where she has got a store. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy perfumes and for organizing her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy perfumes

loans.name: Surayo

texts.ru: Сурайё родилась в 1977 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина. Сурайё работает в ателье. Она портниха. Сурайё предоставляет свои услуги по шитью женской одежды национального и европейского стиля. Она этим бизнесом уже более 3 лет. Сурайё старается предоставить свои услуги на высшем уровне и таком образом привлечь больше клиентов. Сурайё хочет купить автомашину для развития своего бизнеса, то есть она будет использовать автомашину для доставки готовой продукции. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки автомашины. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Surayo was born in 1977.  She is a hard-working woman who is married with three children.  Surayo works as a seamstress in a dress shop, where she sews women's national costumes as well as European-style clothing.  She has been doing this for more than three years.  Surayo strives for high-quality work and for that reason, she has many clients.  She wants to buy a car to increase her business, as it would help her deliver her finished products.  Surayo is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy a car.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a car for her business

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela es una estudiante sacrificada, que salio de su ciudad para poder progresar en la vida, esta cubriendo sus gastos con la ayuda de mis padres.
Está estudiando la carrera de odontología, su objetivo para el futuro es recibirse y poder trabajar y ademas obtener su titulo para asi poder recompensar a sus padres y a su ciudad con la profesión que eligió estudiar. 
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de universidad y de esa forma seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mariela is a self-sacrificing student who left her city to be able to make progress in life. She is covering her costs with her parents' support. She is doing a degree in dentistry. Her goal for the future is to obtain her degree, to be able to work and also become qualified to be able to pay back her parents and her city through the profession she has chosen to follow.

Mariela is asking for this loan to be able to cover her university fees and thus be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicks to raise

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2012 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 2,500. This loan is intended to purchase ingredients for her food vending.

Lourdes dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to purchase various ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a single mother of one child and her child goes to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has a business of a beauty salon and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more hair relaxers, weaves and braids. Her major business challenges include electricity and seasonality. She is aspiring to own a bridal salon and also to buy  aplot of land and build a house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and no to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more hair relaxers, weaves and braids

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a general store where he sells oil, sugar, salad, soap, and sweets. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be not having enough stock. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to purchase additional stock of goods. His business goal is to be a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will see himself succeed, and use the profits from his business to educate his kids. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of goods

loans.name: Ahmmed

texts.en:
Ahmmed is a 32 years old married man with three children. His oldest child is 9 years old and the youngest one is 5 year old. Ahmmed lives with his family in Sana'a, Yemen. He is an educated man with a Secondary education. He worked in a high class hotel in the capital city of Sana'a. Over time, Ahmmed accumulated a good amount of money from his salary and purchased a taxi for transporting people from one station to another in order to earn money. He has worked in this business for many years. He works as a driver in the taxi. Because of that, his taxi has become very old. He spends most of his money and time in the repairing and maintenance it. The maintenance costs him a lot of money. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to buy spare parts and change the motor of the taxi. These new spare parts will help him save a lot of money.

Ahmmed's vision is to repair his taxi and sell it in order to purchase a new one instead of the first. He has a piece of land and, he hopes to build the house on it.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and change the motor of the taxi

loans.name: Benta

texts.en: Benta is a 32 year old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 14 years. She describes herself to be good. She operates a mitumba business where she sells bundles of used shoes. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 14,995 loan to purchase clothing to add to the inventory. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to purchase mitumba clothing to add to the inventory

loans.name: Pretencia

texts.es: Pretencia: Es un señora luchadora, tiene 49 años de edad, desde hace 20 años se dedica a la comercialización de mariscos. Con el propósito de incrementar el inventario de los productos del mar solicita financiamiento, para distribuir sus productos en las empresas pesqueras. Su sueño es vender sus productos en Managua, tener su panga con motor de borda.
texts.en: Pretencia: A hard working woman, 49 years old, who has been working in the sale of seafood for the last 20 years. She is requesting this loan in order to increase her inventory of seafood and to distribute her product to the fishing companies. Her dream is to sell her products in Managua and to have a motor boat.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of seafood.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 38 years old. She is widowed and supports two children, who are 18 and 14 years old. Judith sells clothes, a business she has done for the last six years, earning a monthly income of KES 18,000.

She has requested her third loan from VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 30,000. She will use the loan to add to her stock of clothes.

With the anticipated profits, Judith will be able to pay school fees for her children. Judith's dream is to have a good business and a healthy family.

loans.use: to add to her stock of clothes

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita has been operating her own bakery for many years, and she earns well from this. Having a family requires more efforts to provide for the needs, especially those of the children. She has to work hard, with the determination to have more income, to provide her children better education.

To improve her sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC. She will use the loan to buy raw ingredients, for preparing cakes and pastries to sell. In the future, Lolita hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baking cakes and pastries

loans.name: Kamugenyi Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
Lawrence (shown with his hand raised) is a member of a village bank group. He is a married man with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a farmer, growing beans, cassava and maize for selling and food for his family. 

To diversify his earning, he started buying and selling maize to earn income to improve the livelihood of his family. He is hardworking, but the business is seasonal, depending on weather patterns. His vision is to have a commercial store in urban centers where prices are attractive.

Lawrence needs the loan to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is a male Kiva borrower. He operates a motorcycle transportation service. He has been involved in this business for three years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to expand the business. 

His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have frequent cash flow and a good lifestyle.

loans.use: to expand his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es:
Jonathan es una persona que se esta esforzando por poder ser un profesional útil a la sociedad y a las demás personas. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar sus cuotas, lo que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide nuevamente de este préstamo, para poder cubrir prestamos de su universidad y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Jonathan is a person striving to be a professional, useful to society and to other people. He states that he used his previous loan to make loan payments which was very helpful to him.

Now he is again requesting a loan to be able to cover university loans and continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for his university expenses.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a male Kiva borrower. He operates a motorcycle transport business. He has been involved in this business for two years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to expand the business. 

His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will use the profits from his business to pay fees and save. He hopes to improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: to expand his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 36 years old. He is married to Zilpah and together they are blessed with two children six and two years old.

Joseph operates a butchery, a business he has done for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. He has requested a second loan term of KES 50,000 with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase more pigs to butcher.

With the anticipated profits, Joseph will be able to open another butchery for his wife. His desire and dream for the future is to have his children well educated.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to butcher

loans.name: Gazmir

texts.en:
Gazmir is a 27-year-old divorced father of a 6-year-old boy, of whom he has full custody; both of them have been photographed here.

Gazmir, whose name in English means “Joyful”, does wholesale-buying/wholesale-selling of agricultural products for a living. Luckily, the region of Korca where he resides is known for the largest volume of agricultural products, including grains (wheat, corn, oats, barley and rye); legumes (beans, chickpeas, lentils, peas, lima beans); potatoes; onions (red and white); apples and plums. His clientele mostly includes large markets in the capital city.

Characteristic of Gazmir’s village is that the red wine that villagers produce, still in all primitive ways, has been very much in demand domestically and also across the Albanian borders. 

Gazmir is applying for this loan to buy products for sale.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products for selling.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 43-year-old married man, who has five children. He belongs to a humble family that lives in Haja city, Yemen. He has a Diploma education. Now, he works as a teacher.

Over time, Mohammed accumulated a good amount of money and purchased a piece of land. After more time, he began to build his own house on that land he had purchased. His house is not completed. He needs to build some rooms and finish them. Unfortunately, Mohammed doesn't have enough money to do that. As a result, Mohammed is requesting a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase construction materials, including cement, bricks, and lumber, to complete the home and to build other rooms.

Mohammed's dream in the future is building a large yard for the house and building another floor. He also hopes to supply his house with all home appliances.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for the house he is building.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
