Gladys is a farmer. She grows and harvests kale and cabbage on her farm to earn her living. She has been engaged in this activity for five years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be pests.

She and her husband have eight children.

Gladys has requested a loan in the amount of Kes 20,000. She will use her loan funds to purchase fertilizer for her farmland. 

Her business goal is to buy a plot of land within five years. She hopes that she may improve her family's standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Kaliya

texts.ru: Калия, 54 года, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. Дети все самостоятельные и проживают отдельно. Основной деятельностью Калии является разведение скота и полеводство, чем стала заниматься с 1985 года. Благодаря непосильному труду и емкой работе Калия достигла больших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Калии имеется: 5 дойных коров, 2 лошади и 100 овец. Также земельный надел мерою 2,40 ГА, где Калия выращивает эспарцет и перец. В хозяйстве есть трактор, на котором супруг Калии предоставляет местным жителям сельскохозяйственные услуги. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Калия обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы с теленком и минеральных удобрений. Доходы от кредита Калия планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве, а также в будущем планирует сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Kaliya is 54 years old and she is married with four children who are all grown up and live on their own.  Her main income is from agriculture and raising livestock, which she started doing in 1985.  Thanks to her diligent and capable work, Kaliya has had many successes in increasing her business and she is able to bring in a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  Now her farm has five dairy cows, two horses and 100 sheep, as well as a 2.40 hectare plot of land, where she grows sainfoin and peppers.  There is also a tractor on the farm, which Kaliya's husband rents out to the local residents.  With the goal of developing her business further, Kaliya has turned to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 65,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow, a calf and mineral fertilizer.  She plans to use the income from this loan to further increase the head of livestock on her farm, and she also plans to make repairs on her home in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a cow, a calf and fertilizer

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a married man with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a hardworking man dealing in banana brewing locally to make a local brew known as “Waragi”, which is made from bananas. 

He started this business to generate income to meet the basic needs like medical care for his family. He dreams of educating his children to university. The main challenge faced by Benjamin is price fluctuations of local brew.

Benjamin will use this loan is to rehabilitate his banana plantation by weeding and pruning it.

loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation by weeding and pruning it.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is married and has three children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sisters). She has a beauty salon business. She has been in this business for six years.

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids and other treatments. Her major challenges includes electricity supply and the ever-increasing prices of salon accessories.

Deborah's goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land and build a residential house. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more beauty salon supplies

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a general shop, where she sells a variety of goods. She has been involved in this business for three years. She says her biggest business challenge is a lack of funds.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more quality goods. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be happy. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase more quality goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock in order to expand her business

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She has been running a small general store in her area with the help of her husband, also shown in the picture. She has many years of experience in this field. Over time, the customer base of her store has greatly increased. With the help of income from this store, Naseem has been able to provide her family with good-quality food and clothing. 

She is in her sixth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and has a good repayment history. She has now requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. With this loan, she wants to buy stock of oil, spices, tea, jams, packed juices, etc. to meet the increasing demand in her store. 

She has high hopes for a rise in income, which she wants to spend on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy stock of oil, spices, tea, jams, packed juices, etc.

loans.name: Nilgün

texts.en:
Nilgün is married and the mother of two children. She sews gowns for weddings, engagements and other occasions. She has had her tailoring shop for twenty years. An agreeable, calm, hardworking and also strong woman, Nilgün will use this loan to buy fabric. She wants to earn money to ensure a good future for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Nilgün Hanım,evli ve 2 çocuk annesi.  Nilgün Hanım, gelinlik, nişanlık, abiye kıyafetler dikiyor. Terzi dükkanında 20 yıldır esnaflık yapıyor. Uyumlu, sakin, çalışkan ve aynı zamanda güçlü bir kadın olan Nilgün Hanım bu kredi ile  kumaşlarını almak istiyor. Nilgün Hanımın çocuklarına  iyi bir gelecek sağlamak için bu işten çok para kazanmak en büyük hayalidir.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more accessories, makeup, and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more raw materials and food for her business.

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa is 25 years old and a married woman, from Rafah city. She is the mother of one son and one daughter. Her husband works as an employee, with a low income. This income is barely enough to cover the family expenses. So Walaa opened a small grocery store in the city, where she sells basic goods.

Walaa is seeking a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to increase the inventory in her grocery store. This will increase her sales and income. Walaa appears in the photo, in her grocery store

loans.use: to increase the inventory in her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more accessories, makeup, and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member (mother). 

She operates a retail shop at the market and has been in this business for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy cooking oil, sugar, flour and beans. She gets additional income from selling fried cassava and sweet potatoes. She works in a shop and sells to all categories of people seven days a week. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to get enough profits so as to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar, flour, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rowel

texts.en: Farming has been Rowel's main source of income. He is 41 years of age, married with two children. He has been in the farming business for ten years. With his determination to improve his way of living, he is doing his very best to make his goal possible. Rowel would like to take out a loan of PHP 15,000, allowing him to purchase farm supplies such as insecticides and sacks of fertilizer and pay for labor costs to spray his farmland. He hopes to avail himself of the amount requested for him to obtain plentiful yields this next harvest season and maintain his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as insecticides and sacks of fertilizer and pay for labor costs to spray his rice crop.

loans.name: Nurgül

texts.en:
Nurgül is married and the mother of two children. She began working as a hairdresser at a young age. She was very excited to open her own hair salon. She has been in the same location for 25 years, and over time she has become a popular stylist. She wants to ensure success in life, for herself and her children. With this loan, she will buy a hair dryer and buy new supplies, which will help her attract more customers and increase her earnings.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Nurgül Hanım, evli ve 2 çocuk annesi. Nurgül Hanım,çok küçük yaşlarda kuaförlük mesleğine başlamış. Kendine ait kuaför dükkanını açtığında çok heyecanlanmış. 25 yıl boyunca aynı pasajda ayakta kalmış ve zamanla müşterileri tarafından beğenilen ve çok tutulan bir kuaför olmuş. Nurgül Hanım, kendisi ve 2 çocuğu ile hayat mücadelesini başarıyla sürdürüyor. Bu kredi ile fön makinelerini ve diğer kullandığı malzemeleri yenileyerek müşteri potansiyelinin artacağını ve bol kazanç elde edeceğini düşünüyor.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and buy new supplies

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is 34 years old, married and a mother of five children. She has been making sweaters, caps and pillow covers for almost eight years. She works hard every day to earn a living for her family and provide food, health, and education. Nusrat is requesting her seventh loan from Kashf Foundation for 55,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase bundles of wool and threads in different colors. With the loan, she hopes to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wool and threads in different colors..

loans.name: Liza

texts.es:
Liza tiene un hijo, está en pareja hace unos años, trabaja en un negocio hace varios años, y comenta que está cursando la carrera de Administración de Empresas.
Le gustaría trabajar en una institución financiera para aplicar los conocimientos adquiridos, aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para pagar las cuotas de su universidad para poder llegar a su meta.
texts.en:
Liza has a son and has been in a relationship for several years. She has been working for many years and, now, she explains that she is pursuing a degree in business administration. Liza would like to work in a financial institution to apply her acquired knowledge, increase her income, and improve her family's quality of life.

Liza is requesting this loan to pay her university fees so that she can achieve her goal.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 31-year-old man who is married to Rachael. They are blessed with two children who are two and a half years and one year old. He has been running an Agrovet shop for the last six years. This business has been able to generate a steady monthly income of Kenya shillings 20,000 every year for him.

This will be his second loan after he repaid the other one successfully. He hopes to use this money to add more stock of animal feed and fertilizers for his clients who are increasing by the day. His anticipated income will be used to start building a permanent residence for his family.

He hopes to be the best seller in the area and to provide a better future for his family.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate his house from the inside.

loans.name: Muneeran

texts.en:
Muneeran is 34 years old and a vigorous lady. She has been providing the service of tailoring for many years and is quite skilled at her job. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She has four children.

She requires financial aid to meet her orders on time. Therefore, in her second loan cycle she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. With this loan she intends to purchase a new stitching machine and more stitching materials, such as needles, spools of thread, etc. She wants to generate more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine and more stitching materials, such as needles, spools of thread, etc.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 42-year-old, widowed man. He supports a family of two children. He has been operating a grocery stall for ten years, earning an income of KES 8,000 every month.

James is now servicing his second loan from VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 15,000. He intends to use this amount to buy more stock, including tomatoes, potatoes and onions. His current stock is running out. The profits he earns will be used to pay school fees for his children. James hopes to be a successful businessman, with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy more stock, including tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en: Saeeda is a 54-year-old married woman. She has been running a small grocery store for the past 10 years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She is able to make enough money to provide for her family. Now in her seventh loan cycle, Saeeda has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to buy eatables like rice, sugar, biscuits, tea and flour, and other products like surf and shampoo from the market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand. Saeeda wishes to utilize part of her revenue to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy eatables like rice, sugar, biscuits, tea and flour, and other products like surf and shampoo.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina is 56 years old, married and a mother of two children. She is a very hardworking woman and a dedicated mother. She has been providing the service of stitching in her community for the past five years. She is very skilled in stitching and tailoring. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior in the past. Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads, needles, packs of zips, buttons, laces etc. to meet the increasing customer demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy threads, needles, zippers, buttons, and laces

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Forty-four-year-old Razia has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over 15 years. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today she is proud to be famous in her locality for her embroidery skills. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase frames, thread, needles, beads and sequins for embellishment. She says that the females of her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Razia has taken up. She has seven children and Razia’s dream is to provide them with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase frames, thread, needles, beads and sequins.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en: Naziran is a 55-year-old married woman who has been running a business with her husband selling milk for seven years. They own two cows and one buffalo. They sell milk to many of their neighbors. Naziran also makes butter and cheese with this milk, which generates extra revenue. She looks after the cattle and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. In order to make more profits, Naziran has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR. With this loan she intends to buy another buffalo. She expects a boost in her earnings and profits alongside.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 43-year-old young, brave woman. She has worked very hard to provide for her family. She has one child. She has been running a grocery store with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo) for many years. Abida wants to expand her business. For that reason, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She is in her seventh loan cycle with a good repayment history. With the help of this loan, she wants to purchase more stock of biscuits, beverages, rice, grain etc. Abida wants to use the income she earns to further grow her small shop.

loans.use: to purchase stock of biscuits, beverages, rice, and grain

loans.name: Jamaica

texts.en: Jamaica is 18 years old and single. She is studying engineering. She aims for a succesful career, in order to help her family live comfortably. To achieve this, she needs an educational loan to continue her education. She is asking for PHP 10,000 to pay for tuition and allowances at school, which will enable her to pursue her studies. She and her mother promise to become liable for her loan.

loans.use: to pay for her studies in engineering

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is 34 years old vigorous lady. She has been providing the service of tailoring to her community for the many years, with the help of her husband. She stitches clothes for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She is proud to be contributing to her household income. She has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR to Kashf foundation. She is in her 4th loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support. She wants to purchase a new stitching machine along with some spool of threads.  She is hopeful that her hard work will pay and she will be able to provide a good life to her 2 children.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine along with some spool of threads.

loans.name: Wailat

texts.en: Wailat and her husband, also shown in the photo, were able to purchase stocks of rice and flour along with packs of biscuits and beverages for her general store business, with the previous Kiva loan. She is thankful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial help.  She has improved the variety of items in her shop. Now, she has requested for her second Kiva loan of 45000 PKR. With this loan she intends to purchase stock of tea, packed milk, coffee, rice etc. She further wants to expand her business to provide better living standards for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock of tea, packed milk, coffee, rice etc.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.es:
Mercedita: Es una mujer trabajadora, originaria de Waspam, tiene 47 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijas. Desde hace 30 años habita en vivienda de tambo de madera con 6 personas. Con el propósito de tener su vivienda de concreto solicita financiamiento, para comprar materiales de construcción: cemento, arena fina, arena gruesa, bloques, hierro, zinc, clavo y madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra.  Su sueño es brindarle a su familia una vivienda segura y con las condiciones adecuadas.

En la fotografia se muestran a madre e hijas.
texts.en:
Mercedita is a hardworking woman, native to Waspam. She is 47 years old, married, and the mother of two daughters. She has lived in a wooden house with 6 people for the last 30 years. With the goal of having a house made from concrete, Mercedita is requesting this loan to buy construction materials: cement, fine sand, thick sand, cinderblocks, iron, zinc, nails, and wood, as well as cover the costs of labor. Her dream is to provide her family with a safe home that is in good condition.

Pictured in the photo above are Mercedita and her two daughters.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: cement, fine sand, thick sand, cinderblocks, iron, zinc, nails, and wood, as well as cover the costs of labor.

loans.name: Stefany Betzaida

texts.es: Stefany: Es una joven alegre y sociable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 2 años estableció su negocio de venta de ropa nueva, en un tramo que alquila en el mercado, pagando una mensualidad de C$ 2,000 (Dos mil córdobas netos). Solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar mercadería en Managua: ropa interior, pantalones, camisas, zapatos para niños, niñas, mujeres y hombres. Su sueño es construir su propia vivienda y tener su propio tramo.
texts.en:
Stefany is a happy and sociable young woman from Puerto Cabezas. With the goal of having her own source of income, she opened her own business selling clothing two years ago. Her business is located in a section of the market that she rents for 2,000 córdobas each month. Stefany is requesting this second loan in order to buy merchandise in Managua: underwear, pants, shirts, and shoes for women, men, and children.

Her dream is to build her own home and own a spot in the market.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in Managua: underwear, pants, shirts, and shoes for women, men, and children.

loans.name: El Eden Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Eden está en su ciclo número 2º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.  Todas ellas participan activamente en las actividades propuestas por el grupo, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que es poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo.
Francisca es una de ellas, quien a través de la venta de prendas está luchando por poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener y evitar que pase por privaciones.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas para la venta, como ser jeans, remeras, camisas, pantalones y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The "El Eden" group is on its second lending cycle of the women's committee program, in which everybody works and helps each other to keep going. All of them participate actively in the activities laid out by the group. They help each other mutually to achieve their common objective, which is to be able to help their families through their work.

Francisca is one of them. Through the sale of clothing, she is striving to be able to give her loved ones all that she was not able to have and to keep them from experiencing deprivation.

She is requesting this loan so she can invest it in the purchase of various garments to sell, like jeans, t-shirts, shirts, pants, and more. With this investment, she will be able to continue to sell like she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, shirts, pants, and more to sell

loans.name: Sani

texts.en: Sani is a 33-year- old farmer from Gidan Mayau Rumi. As a Babban Gona member, Sani, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Sani can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Sani is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Sani said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; Comfort,   Gift, and  Bege, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Heri Ya Mungu Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Kwabo est une commerçante d’une expérience de 6 ans, âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants, dont 8 étudient et 1 encore gosse. La cliente est présidente et membre d’un groupe d’Affaires «Heri ya Mungu». Elle est vendeuse des produits pharmaceutiques. Elle installe ses marchandises dans une pharmacie sur la route principale de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter   des boites de médicaments modernes (Antibiotiques, anti-inflammatoires etc.). Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un infirmier. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de microcrédit, pendant, ce moment post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Kwabo is a business owner with six years of experience. She is 40 years, married, and mother of nine children, eight of which are in school while one is still too young.  The client is president and member of the Heri Ya Mungu Group. She sells pharmaceuticals.  She displays her merchandise in a pharmacy along the main city road.  She is asking for a loan from Hekima in order to grow her business.  She will buy boxes of modern medicine (antibiotics, anti-inflammatories, etc.) She started her business with funds from her husband.  Her spouse is a nurse.  In the future, she wishes to grow her business, put her children in school, and feed her children.  She thanks Hekima for helping female entrepreneurs who don't qualify for traditional bank loans by giving them micro-loans during this post-conflict period in the eastern region of the country.

loans.use: to buy boxes of modern medicine (antibiotics, anti-inflammatories, etc.)

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia has successfully built her business of general store with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Her husband helped in purchasing stock of goods from the wholesale market.  Previously with the help of Kiva loan she was able to expand her business. With increasing demands of her customers currently she has requested for is 40000 PKR to buy stock of oil, rice, spices, biscuits, beverages etc. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand of their customers, consistently. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good credit history.  She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with the expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of oil, rice, spices, biscuits, beverages etc.

loans.name: Ella Jean

texts.es: Ella Jean: Es una mujer amable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 37 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos. Su esposo es policía.  Solicita financiamiento para pintar vivienda y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es brindarle a su familia una vivienda con las condiciones adecuadas.
texts.en: Ella Jean is a nice woman from Puerto Cabezas.  She is 37 years old, and she is married with 2 children. Her husband is a policeman. She is requesting a loan in order to paint her home and cover the costs of labor. Her dream is to provide her family with decent living conditions.

loans.use: to paint her home and cover the costs of labor.

loans.name: Heng Group

texts.en: Heng is 35 years old, a farmer, and a married woman with three children. One of her children is a student. Her husband is also a farmer. They live in Tbong Khmum Province, Cambodia. They have been farmers since 2004. Both of them can earn approximately $14 per day. Now Heng would like to request a loan of 810,000 Riels as a group of three members and she will use her portion to buy concrete sewers and other foundation parts of a latrine. This loan will help her live in better conditions and avoid illnesses. In the future, she is going to build a new house and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy concrete sewers and other foundation parts of a latrine

loans.name: Challote

texts.en:
Challote is a married woman. She has two children, both of whom attend school. Challote lives in the family house. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Challote operates a soft drinks and fish-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business.

With the GHS 2000, she wants to purchase more soft drinks and fish for resale. She decided to join ID-Ghana to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks and fish for resale.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Las 16 integrantes de este comité se unieron con el objetivo de poder trabajar juntas, las unas a las otras, y conforme a ese trabajo poder crecer y salir adelante.
Mirta, una de ellas, se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante, comenta que con sacrificio y esfuerzo se fue armando de clientela, y que hoy en día ya se formo una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella las comidas que hace.
Pide este préstamo que le servirá para poder comprar insumos varios para poder seguir haciendo las comidas que vende, como jamón, queso, verduras, carne, pollo y demás. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
texts.en:
The 16 members of the committee joined together with the goal of being able to work together and use this work to be able to grow and get ahead. 

Mirta, one of them, sells food that she makes and then sells on foot. She says that with sacrifice and effort she created a client base and now has clients who always buy the foods that she makes from her. She is asking for this loan that will allow her to buy ingredients in order to keep making that food that she sells like ham, cheese, vegetables, meat, chicken, and other things. She is a hardworking and entrepreneurial person.

loans.use: to buy ham, cheese, vegetables, meat, chicken, and other ingredients to continue preparing food.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza 41 years old and she lives in the city of Ararat. She is divorced and she alone takes care of her two children. Her elder daughter is employed and she works at the market and her smaller daughter is a student. Liza without any higher education through many years till now manages to cover all the needs of her two pretty daughters. She worked as a backer. Now she works at the food market as a saleswoman. Liza now needs urgent help since she is worried about her smaller daughter’s health. 
She asks a loan of 500.000 Armenian drams in order to be able to pay at the hospital for the medical examinations and for treatment as well.  She promises and hopes to inform us about her daughter’s wellness very soon.

loans.use: to pay at the hospital for the medical examinations and for treatment as well

loans.name: Gie Diappo Liggey Keur Kabe Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Diappo Liggey Keur Kabe, a été créé il y a quelques années de cela. Son activité principale consiste à l’exploitation de la terre donc l’agriculture. Par le biais de son président, monsieur, Kéba, le GIE vient solliciter un crédit pour l’achat de semences,d’engrais et de pesticides, mais aussi de matériel agricole pour mettre en place une unité de production de céréales. 
Kéba, habillé en bleu,  est un père de famille, marié à une femme. Il est très actif et l’initiative de faire naitre ce GIE vient de lui car il veut créer des emplois, montrer l’importance de la terre, de l’agriculture dans le processus de développement des pays pauvres. Avec les revenus de cette activité, il gère sa famille et l’éducation de ses enfants.
Avec l’appui qu’il pense obtenir de l’IMCEC, il crois fermement à la réussite de son ambition.
texts.en: Le Gie Diappo Liggey Keur Kabe Group was created a few years ago.  Its main business is agriculture. Through its president Mr. Keba, Gie Group is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide, but also agricultural equipment to set up production of grain.  Keba, dressed in blue, is a father and married to a woman.  He is very active and initiated the creation of the Gie Group because he wanted to create jobs and show the importance of land and agriculture in the economic development of poor countries.  With the revenues from his business, he takes care of his family and the education of his children.  With the financial support he plans to obtain from IMCEC, he firmly believes in the success of his ambitions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Pora se destaca por su arduo trabajo y las ganas de salir adelante que tiene cada una de las integrantes. En  la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza 5 de ellas aun se encuentran luchando por mejorar.
Salome se dedica a la venta de crochet que ella misma hace y que después sale vende a su clientela de la zona. Salome comenta que aprendió este oficio hace ya muchos años, y que por medio de el ayuda a su familia y les da todo lo que no pudieron tener.
Salome pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para seguir haciendo sus crochet, como hilos, agujas, y demás, de manera a seguir con su trabajo. Ella esta agradecida por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder crecer.
texts.en:
The group called Kuña Pora is notable for their hard work and each members' desire to get ahead. In the poverty elimination survey, five of them were fighting to make improvements.  

Salome sells crocheted products that she makes and sells to local clients. Salome says that she learned this trade many years ago and she supports her family and gives them all that they could never have through it. Salome is applying for this loan in order to buy materials to continue crocheting like thread, needles, and other products. She is thankful for the opportunity to grow that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, and other materials in order to crochet.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas está en el segundo ciclo del programa de comites, ademàs estan haciendo la encuesta de eliminacion de la pobreza como un medio de poder trabajar y salir adelante.
Una de ellas es la señóra Mirian, quien en su encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que debe esforzarse un poco mas, para poder crecer. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas, que con mucho sacrificio hace todos los dias desde muy temprandas horas, es muy luchadora y comenta que por medio de ese trabajo sus seres queridos tienen para el día a dia.
Hoy Mirian pide este prestamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, como jeans, remeras, camisas, pantalones y demàs, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas mejorando.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Unidas is in the second cycle of the committee program in addition to participating in the elimination of poverty surveys in order to continue working and getting ahead. 

One of them is Mirian, whose survey showed a poverty level under level 1. This demonstrates that she should work in order to get ahead. She sells clothing, working hard every day beginning very early. She is very hardworking and says that she provides for her loved ones every day through her work. Today, Mirian is applying for a loan in order to buy various garments to sell like jeans, t-shirts, shirts, pants, and others so she can continue improving sales.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts,  shirts, pants, and more.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school. She has a retail shop and has been in this business for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more sugar, soap, cooking oil and salt. She generates additional income from a food stall.  She works in a shop seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis.  Her major business challenges include thieves and ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She is aspiring to become a fully stocked retail shop and also to buy a plot of land and build a house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and no to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap, cooking oil and salt

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
José, fortaleció su negocio de reparación de bicicletas con la inversión del crédito anterior, comprándose repuestos para realizar un buen trabajo, sus utilidades mejoraron, poco a poco ha ido cancelando sus deudas y su familia se mantiene.
Por los buenos resultados y la buena atención que le  brinda la institución, se decidió por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar parches, llantas, neumáticos, pedales, cadenas, etc., mantendrá el buen servicio y cubrirá la demanda de sus nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
José strengthened his bicycle repair business by investing the funds from his prior loan. He purchased spare parts so he could do quality work, his service improved, and he has been able to steadily pay off his debts and support his family. 

José decided to apply for another loan because of the positive results of the first one, and the excellent service that the lender provided. José will use the loan funds to purchase patches for inner tubes, wheel rims, tires, pedals, chains and other bicycle parts. These investments will allow José to maintain his high level of service and meet the demand from his new customers.

loans.use: to purchase patches for inner tubes, wheel rims, tires, pedals, chains, and other bicycle parts.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en: Suleiman remembers the depression he felt  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Suleiman, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Suleiman is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, expressed Suleiman.  With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Sandra Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Sandra del Socorro, labora como comerciante de CD y DVD en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León,  desde hace 16 años  inicia su labores  a las 07:00 am finalizando a las 05:00 pm en  este mismo horario de lunes a sábado, realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Doña Sandra,  solicito a  Ceprodel  un crédito el que utilizo para mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda como es la compra de puerta de hierro y su instalación, lo cual le permitirá mejorar la seguridad a su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Señora Sandra del Socorro has been selling CDs and DVDs in one of the markets in the city of León for 16 years. She starts working at 7:00 A.M. and she finishes at 5:00 P.M., following this schedule Monday through Saturday. She does this work in order to provide for her home.

Doña Sandra requested a loan from CEPRODEL in order to improve the infrastructure of her home by purchasing and installing an iron door, which will allow her to make her simple home more secure.

loans.use: to purchase and install an iron door.

loans.name: Mouna

texts.en:
Mouna is a 42-year-old mother of two, who has fourteen years of experience in hand made accessories, souvenirs and many other creative items. In 2006, she started her own business so that she can support her husband in covering their family's increasing needs, and their children education expenses. 
Mouna started this business as a hobby, she developed her talents through special vocational trainings, to make sure that she can do what's best for developing her career and impressing her customers.
Mouna participates in exhibitions in order to market her production and make her name well known. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with new released accessories items to develop her creations and increase her selling. 
She hopes that in the future she can open her separate shop outside her house and display her work in a well manged way.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with new released accessories items to develop her creations and increase her selling

loans.name: Musa Kalle

texts.en:
Musa Kalle is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Musa Kalle joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Shamsiyya, Harisa, and  Zainab. Musa Kalle is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Musa Kalle will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Musa Kalle can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14, and earn up to $2000/hectare - more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Musa Kalle is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long-term goal is to “ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: to access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 31 years old single man. He has a University education. Adel lives a lone in a rented house in Sana'a city, Yemen. He has a master's degree in administration of justice. Now, Adel is an employee in a public sector with a good salary. He is very active and dynamic man. He hopes to become a leader in the future. He is very clever man and knows how he can run his life very well. The house where he lives lacks of many of home appliances and Adel prepares the house to get married soon. For this reason, Adel applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase furniture to the house.

Adel looks forward to purchasing a nice car and purchasing a large and comfortable for himself.

loans.use: to purchase furniture to the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more repair parts for his workshop.

loans.name: Yiindi Diam Keur Demba Group

texts.fr:
Yinndi Diam Keur Demba, est un groupe de crédit qui vient pour la 3ème fois solliciter un prêt pour leur activité agricole. Il a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans ce domaine d’activité. Il est composé de 5 femmes qui appartiennent à la même ethnie. La dame Awa est la responsable du groupe, elle est mariée et mère de famille (elle se trouve au milieu sur la photo). Avec le crédit, elle compte acheter des semences et de l’engrais pour cultiver sa parcelle de terre qu’elle partage avec son époux et dont les revenus serviront à alimenter la famille et à régler les autres besoins. 
Awa désire dans l’avenir, allier l’agriculture et l’élevage de moutons et de bœufs que son mari pratique déjà.
texts.en: Yinndi Diam Keur Demba Group is asking for their third loan for their agricultural business. The group has over five years of experience in this industry and consists of five women who belong to the same ethnic group.  The woman Awa is the representative of the group. She is married and a mother. (She is in the middle of the photo.)  With this loan, she plans to buy seeds and fertilizer to cultivate the plot of land that she shares with her husband. The income will help them feel their family and pay for other needs.  In the future, Awa wishes to combine farming and the raising of sheep and cattle which her husband already does.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en:
Ezra, age 31, lives with his wife and two sisters in Lusaka, the capital city of Zambia. He is applying for his very first Kiva loan to purchase a Zoona-branded trading booth, from which he will run his own mobile money transfer business.

Ezra would like to open his own outlet so that he can earn more income and provide better for his family. He is a big believer in the mobile money industry and the service it provides the country. Many people are in need of accessible and easy ways to transfer money in Zambia, he says. He has found a good location for his shop and is excited to get his operation under way.

Ezra’s goal is to work hard and grow his first outlet so that he can open additional outlets and provide better opportunities for his family. He is grateful for the chance to receive a small loan through Kiva lenders. He acknowledges how much this will help him in beginning to scale up his business.

loans.use: to purchase a Zoona-branded trading booth, from which he will run his own mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Yahaya Chansa

texts.en: Yahaya Chansa is a 30-year-old farmer from Chiroma.  As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya Chansa, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yahaya Chansa can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Yahaya Chansa is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least  80 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Yahaya Chansa is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; James,  and  Ummi. Yahaya Chansa’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Ushindi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Marie anne est commerçante depuis 10 ans, trésorière et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Ushindi», entrepreneur, âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants, qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés, elle étale son business dans le marché du centre ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 30 paires de souliers. Son conjoint est un militaire de l’armée loyaliste. Elle débuta avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre sonentreprise,  scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en  leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en: Marie-Anne has been a business owner for 10 years. She is treasurer and member of the Ushindi Group.  She is an entrepreneur, 40-years old, married, and mother of eight children, all of whom attend school.  She sells used shoes in the market downtown.  She is asking for a loan from Hekima to grow her business.  She will buy 30 pairs of shoes. Her spouse is a soldier in the loyalist army. She started her business from funds received from her husband. In the future, she wishes to grow her business, put her children in school, and feed them.  She thanks Hekima for wisely choosing their objective: supporting female entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system by extending them loans without material collateral.

loans.use: to buy 30 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a 33 year old lady who is single and supports her younger siblings. She runs a retail shop and a posho mill business in her locality. This has been her business for the last five years and she is able to make a monthly income of Kenya shillings 40,000.

She has applied for her fifth loan with ViaionFund Kenya to add more stock in her retail shop for items like sugar, tea leaves, flour and cooking oil. She anticipates a profit which she will use to repay her loan as well as develop her home.

In future she would like to be successful in life and stay happy.

loans.use: to add more stock in her retail shop for items like sugar, tea leaves, flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 44-year-old married mother of two, who works in selling clothes for four years, to support her husband in increasing their family's income and covering the necessary living needs.
Zeinab is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with new released collection especially for the Holy month of Ramadan Celebrations. She is very anxious about this loan and is looking forward to develop her business properly.
At the beginning Zeinab started her business from her house, then she gradually develop it and opened her current shop. She is looking forward to start wholesale trade in the future and she is looking forward to it.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with new released collection especially for the Holy month of Ramadan Celebrations

loans.name: Takku Liggey Pacathiaré Ndawène Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de crédit, Takku Liggey Pacathiaré Ndawène regroupe des femmes qui s’activent dans l’agriculture depuis des années. Il vient solliciter un crédit pour la seconde fois afin d’acheter des semences, de l’engrais et des pesticides et pouvoir cultiver leur champs. Assane, à gauche sur la photo est la responsable du groupe ; elle est mariée et mère de famille. Son groupe est constitué de ses voisines avec qui elle loge dans le même quartier. C’est grâce à cette activité, qu’elle peut appuyer son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille, mais pour améliorer les conditions alimentaires de cette dernière, Assane veut démarrer une autre activité : l’embouche bovine : à petit échelle d’abord, jusqu’à ce qu’elle ait la capacité d’élever beaucoup.
texts.en: Takku Liggey Pacathiaré Ndawène Group consists of women who have been active in agriculture for years.  The group is asking for their second loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for the cultivation of their fields.  Assane, at the left of the photo, is the representative of the group.  She is married and a mother. Her group consists of her neighbors with whom she lives in the same neighborhood.  It is thanks to this business that she can help her husband take care of their family's household expenses.  But in order to improve their family diet, Assane wants to start another business: cattle fattening, on a small scale at first, until she has the capacity to raise many.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 50-year-old divorced Iraqi citizen, who has worked in a communication business in Lebanon since 2008, with fourteen years of experience.

Sahar is hard worker, who puts so much effort into developing her career to improve her living in a well-managed way.

She is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay what's left from her car's price to register it officially to drive it freely. She hopes to keep on developing her job to get a special position in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her car so she can register it and drive it freely.

loans.name: Universal Group

texts.en:
The group Universal is composed of four persons, who reside in the same town. They are into cosmetics, provisions, soft drinks, fresh fish and plastics items. 
The group’s representative, named Gladys who is 46, married with children who go to school. She lives together with her children and husband. The couple jointly cover the household expenses. 

For nearly five years, Gladys has been selling cosmetics out of her house. She gets her supplies at a market in Ghana. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and grow her revenues, Gladys and the other members of the group universal are requesting a fifth loan from ID-Ghana. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food stuffs such as milk, sardines, luncheon-meat, etc

loans.name: Alhaji Safiya

texts.en:
Alhaji Safiya is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Alhaji Safiya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Idris, Bala, and Ibrahim. Alhaji Safiya is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Alhaji Safiya will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Alhaji Safiya can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14, and earn up to $2000/hectare - more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.

When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to expand my farmland.” Alhaji Safiya is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long-term goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: to access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Alhaji Lawal

texts.en: Alhaji Lawal remembers feeling depressed during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Lawal, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000 per hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags per hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Alhaji Lawal is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  He expressed that “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Alhaji Lawal is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double his yield and income

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en: Saratu remembers not being able to feed her family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now Saratu, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000 per hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags per hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Saratu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Saratu. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seeds in order to double her income and yield.

loans.name: Rashila

texts.en: Rashila remembers the extreme poverty that her family faced during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona member. Now, Rashila, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to 2,000 USD/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Rashila is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. “In five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community,” expressed Rashila. With this loan, Rashila is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Fortunate

texts.en: Fortunate is a 21-year-old businesswoman from the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She was encouraged to start her business of selling clothes by her sister and other members of CAMA (Camfed's alumnae organization) so that she could financially support herself. During her spare time, Fortunate volunteers each week as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local school in her community. With the Kiva loan, Fortunate intends to buy more clothes to increase her profits. She will then be able to better support her siblings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a 20-year-old businesswoman from the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been selling clothes, shoes, and blankets for six months now. She was encouraged by other Cama (Camfed's alumnae organization) members to venture into entrepreneurship so that she could look after herself and her siblings. Gladys also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide and assists school children with their studies every week. With the Kiva loan, Gladys intends to purchase more clothes, shoes, and blankets from wholesalers. This will help her maximize sales and profits. With the additional profits, Gladys intends to further her education. She would like to enroll in a teachers’ college and train to become a primary school teacher.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes, shoes, and blankets

loans.name: Fátima De La Paz

texts.es:
Fátima de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta 3º grado, esta casada, su esposo trabaja en un pequeño taller de bicicletas que tiene en su casa, sus 3 hijos le ayudan con el pequeño taller,  2 de sus hijos estudian.

Fátima por su parte se dedica a la venta de ropa, actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años y lo aprendió de una tía,  y le a dado buenos resultados y lo realiza en diferentes comunidades vecinas en algunas ocasiones  su esposo la acompaña estas son las actividades que ellos realizan para sacar adelante a su familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  mas ropa para surtir su negocio y repuestos para el taller de su esposo,  también terminara de construir una habitación mas a su casa.

  Los suenos de Fátima son surtir su negocio con ropa para ambos sexo y para diferentes edades,  mejorar el taller de su esposo con mas maquinaria y luego preparar académicamente a sus hijos y hacerle mas mejoras a su casa y espera de que Dios le de salud para  seguir trabajando para que esto se le haga realidad y gracias a los créditos espera lograrlos.
texts.en:
Fátima, age 31, studied until the third grade. She is married, and her husband works in a small bicycle repair shop that he has in their home. Their three children help him with the little repair shop. Two of their children are studying.  

For her part, Fátima sells clothing, an occupation that she has been engaged in for three years. She learned it from an aunt, and it has been successful for her. She carries out her work in different neighboring communities, and sometimes her husband accompanies her. This is what they do in order to provide for their family.

The loan that she is seeking is for the purchase of more clothing in order to stock her business, and for parts for her husband’s repair shop.  She will also finish building another room for her house.  

Fátima’s dreams are: to stock her business with clothing for both sexes and for different ages, to improve her husband’s repair shop with more machinery, to prepare her children academically, and make more improvements to her house. She hopes that God will grant her the health to continue working so that these may become reality, and thanks to the loans, she expects to achieve them.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing in order to stock her business, and spare parts for her husband's repair shop. She will also finish building another room for her house.

loans.name: Ferial

texts.en:
Ferial is a 52-year-old married mother of one child. She has been selling accessories since 2010 to support her husband in covering her family's living needs. She is a hard worker, well known in her region for the special prices and quality of products she sells. She started her business selling very small quantities, then she gradually developed it until she had a good income. She invested her profits by buying a van for her husband to transport students from school as a source of good income. 

Ferial is acquiring her second loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special newly released accessories. These will help her to increase her sales, especially for celebrations at the end of the holy month of Ramadan. She hopes to stay capable of supporting her family and expanding her business properly.

loans.use: To increase her inventory with newly released accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cain juice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy enough goods (Slippers, blouses etc ) to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 26 years old. She is married and has a four-year old son. She has just completed training with Zoona to finally make her dream of running her own business come true. Mercy needs a loan to make her dream a reality. 
When Mercy finished secondary school, she took a short course in public realtions. She describes herself as a hard worker who has passed through a lot of ups and downs in her life. She says this makes her very strong and focused in whatever she applies herself too.
Mercy will use this loan to start up a business of mobile money transfers by purchasing a trading booth, which she can use to serve her customers. She will also use the money to buy a mobile phone which she will use to facilitate transactions.  Mercy explains how running her own business will give her the opportunity to improve her families basic needs. This prospect excites her and she cannot wait to begin operating her very own Zoona mobile money outlet. She thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a trading booth and an internet enabled phone

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 23 years-old. She is the first born in a family of eight. For the past two years she has been working for a Zoona entrepreuer as a shop teller. Through hard work and demonstrating the ability to succeed Mercy has been given the opportunity to start her own Zoona mobile money franchise. She is excited about the opportunity this will bring her to increase her income and improve the livelihood of her family. 

Mercy will set up her booth in one of Lusaka’s most densely populated locations, an area called Chawama. She says by setting up the business in this location, people in that area will no longer have to go into the town centre to access financial services. When Mercy gets her loan, she will use it to purchase a trading booth and a mobile phone which she can use to service her customers. 

Mercy is confident that her life will change once she starts running her own business, she  sees the business as a way to empower some of her family members who are not employed.  She explains how being given this opportunity means a lot to her and she will work hard to grow her business, expand to new areas, and earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase a trading booth and a mobile phone which she can use to service her customers.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is 24 years old. She completed high school in 2009, but could not go to college because she could not afford to pay tuition fees. Still wanting to attend college in the future she began working for a Zoona mobile money entreprenuer as a shop teller. Because of Selina’s hardwork she was given an opportunity to start running her own mobile money transfers business in Chingola. After years in the business she is excited to be able to own and operate her very own Zoona outlet now. 

Selina has requested a Kiva loan so that she can start running her business successfully from day one. She will use her Kiva loan to purchase a Zoona-branded trading booth, from which she will serve customers with their money transfer needs. The money remaining from the loan will be spent on purchasing a quality mobile phone, which is a key piece of equipment in operating her business efficiently.

Selina’s biggest dream is to go to college and study Business Administration one day. She is hopeful that once her business becomes profitable, she can pay for her studies while she continues to manage her growing business. She sees this Kiva loan as an important step in achieving her goals of becoming an succeful business women with a college diploma one day.

loans.use: to purchase a Zoona-branded trading booth, from which she will serve customers with their money transfer needs

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en:
Maryamu is a 28-year-old farmer from Kwankwani. As a Babban Gona member, Maryamu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Maryamu can earn up to $2000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Maryamu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.

When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make as a Babban Gona member, she said, “I plan to use the money to educate my children: Mathew, Aaron, and Sadik. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” With this loan she is well on her way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Vimbai

texts.en: Vimbai is a 29-year-old married mother of two from the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. Vimbai volunteers every week as a Camfed Learner Guide at a local school teaching life skills to young students. Vimbai is also a businesswoman. She has been growing tomatoes, cabbages, potatoes and other vegetables to sell to nearby communities for the past seven years. With the Kiva loan, Vimbai will purchase farming supplies such as fertilizer and seeds to increase the productivity of her garden. Her hope is to grow the business and be a commercial farmer. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies such as fertilizer and seeds to increase the productivity of her garden.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a 53-year-old married woman with two children. She has worked as a tailor since 1983, so has long and wide experience in her domain. In 2009 she started her own business to support her husband through a better additional income. 

Marie is acquiring her sixth loan cycle from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy an special iron machine (Presser) which eases her work in a more professional way. Her previous loans were invested in buying a special updated sewing machine, in addition to a tailoring stand and necessary tailoring tools, which helped her a lot in improving her quality and quantity of work, and reflected positively on her social and financial situation. 

She is also a good borrower that Al Majmoua is proud to deal with. Marie hopes to open her own atelier (workshop) as soon as possible, and find herself to be a famous tailor in a wider region.

loans.use: to buy a presser machine (special iron) to make her work easier.

loans.name: Santos Gabino

texts.es:
Santos, con ayudo del préstamo anterior tuvo el alimento necesario para el ganado y logro poner  a la venta nuevos productos, obteniendo mejores venta e ingresos, cuenta con nuevos clientes y ha respondido positivamente a sus compromisos.
Con el fin de mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contar con los ingresos que necesita, opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar granos básicos, sal, azúcar, aceite, huevos, jabón, detergentes, golosinas, pan, bebidas y concentrado para el ganado.
texts.en: Santos, with help from the previous loan, had the necessary food for his livestock and managed to put new products for sale, obtaining better sales and income. He counts on new customers and has responded positively to his commitments. With the intention of maintaining satisfied customers and counting on the income that he needs, he opts for a new loan in order to buy bulk grains, salt, sugar, oil, eggs, soap, detergents, sweets, bread, drinks, and feed for livestock.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, salt, sugar, oil, eggs, soap, detergents, sweets, bread, drinks, and feed for livestock.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 40 years old, married to Patricia, and blessed with three school-going children. For seven years he has been running a retail shop where he sells small consumable goods, e.g. sugar, salt, rice, sweets, soft drinks, etc. This is Stephen's second loan from Vision Fund Kenya and he plans to buy more stock of sugar, rice and sweets for sale. The anticipated income he will save, and in the future he hopes to buy a plot and build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of retail goods

loans.name: Juan Vicente

texts.es:
Juan, es una persona muy responsable que se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte de pasajeros y carga, es una actividad que desarrolla desde hace nueve años, en un horario de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., lo  ha emprendido por cuenta propia; es casado, vive solo con su esposa, no tiene hijos, don Juan es el único que trabaja para cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
Invertirá el capital  comprar llantas, pagara tapizado y el mantenimiento del motor, con lo que espera brindar un buen servicio con mayor seguridad, atraer nuevos clientes y mejorar sus ingresos para tener un buen record crediticio.
Sus aspiraciones son seguir trabajando para ampliar su negocio con la compra de un nuevo vehículo y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.
texts.en:
Juan is a very responsible person who provides transportation services for passengers and cargo. He has been in this business for 9 years and he works from 8 am until 5 pm. He started this business on his own initiative. He is married and lives alone with his wife as they don't have any children. Juan is the only one who works to pay the household expenses.

He will invest the capital buying tires, paying to recover the upholstery and do maintenance on the motor. By doing this he hopes to offer a good service with more security to attract new clients, improve his income and have a good credit rating. His dreams are to continue working to expand his business, buy a new vehicle and pay for the basic necessities of his household.

loans.use: to buy tires, pay for reupholstering and maintenance on the motor.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is married with five children, four of whom go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (mother). She sells used clothes and has been in this business for 3 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings form MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity.  She works seven days a week and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to get enough profits so as to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to offer for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas, plantains, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en: Maryamu remembers not being able to feed her family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Maryamu - like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, which is double the national average of 14. However, Maryamu  is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season due to the high quality inputs and services she will obtain as a result of this loan. When asked about her plans for the future, Maryamu said: “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Maryamu is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality inputs in order to double her yield and income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods to sell; that is salt, a gallon of oil, rice and meat, etc.

loans.name: Elizabet Ignacia

texts.es:
Elizabet es una mujer de 37 años de edad soltera, madre de un hijo y su negocio es la venta de short por mayor al interior del país.
Ella es una persona sociable y amable, le gusta mucho viajar; actividad que realiza por trabajo.
Su negocio es la venta de short (pantalón corto deportivo) por mayor; ella viaja cada semana desde la ciudad de La Paz hasta la ciudad de Cochabamba distante a 8 horas de viaje en bus, llevando su mercadería, para retornar la siguiente semana y realizar la misma rutina.
Elizabet es una mujer de tez morena, su cabello es negro y trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional de pollera. Su sueño es distribuir material deportivo por todo el país y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo.
Ella necesita ampliar sus ventas por temporada, realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de ropa para poder abastecer sus pedidos y generar más ingresos económicos.
Es por esos motivos que Elizabet solicita un préstamo para la compra de short por mayor para abastecer a sus clientes y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo.
texts.en:
Elizabet, 37, is single and the mother of one child.  She's a sociable and friendly woman.  She very much likes to travel, which she does for her job.

Her business is selling athletic shorts wholesale to the interior of the country.  She travels every week from the city of La Paz to the city of Cochabamba, eight hours on the bus.  She takes her merchandise with her and returns the following week with the same routine.

Elizabet is dark skinned, wears her black hair in a braid, and dresses in the traditional "pollera" [skirt].  Her dream is to sell athletic goods throughout the country and improve her son's quality of life.

Elizabet needs to expand her seasonal sales and buy a large quantity of clothing to fill her orders and generate more income.  She's requesting a loan to buy shorts wholesale so she can supply her customers and improve her son's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shorts wholesale

loans.name: Bilge

texts.en:
Bilge works on a farm, taking care of animals and raising vegetables. In addition, she wants to do something new to earn money. She began making food products, such as savory pastries, stuffed grape leaves, lentil balls and bulgar salad, and selling them to markets and restaurants. She’ll use the loan to buy ingredients. She’ll buy at better prices and earn more money.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Bilge Hanım tarımda çalışır,hayvan bakar,sebze yetiştirirdi.  Bunların yanında yenilik yapıp sıcak para akışı olsun istemiş.  Gıda üretimine başlamış.  Sigara böreği,sarma,mercimek köftesi,kısır gibi yiyecekler ve  ev ekmeği pişirerek hazırlayıp market ve lokantalarda satışa sunmuş.  Aldığı krediyle,malzeme alacak.  Daha ekonomik alış veriş yapacak.  Daha çok kazanacak.

loans.use: to buy ingredients at better prices.

loans.name: Ayşe

texts.en:
Ayşe is married and the mother of one child. After running a wedding hall for many years, she opened a house of henna. She rents and sells traditional outfits as well as henna products at the shop. Ayşe, who lives with her daughter, has had a very good response from her friends and customers. As she believes it will last long term, she will use the loan to buy a variety of products.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Ayşe Hanım,evli ve 1 çocuk annesi.Ayşe Hanım, uzun zaman düğün salonu işlettikten sonra 1 ay önce Kına Evi açtı. Dükkanında kına malzemeleri, bindallı satışı ve kiralaması yapıyor. Kızı ile birlikte yaşayan Ayşe Hanım; çevresinden ve müşterilerinden çok olumlu tepkiler alıyor. Bu işte kalıcı olacağına inanan Ayşe Hanım, kredi ile çeşitli malzemeler alacak.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to sell.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu Mathew is a 49-year-old farmer from Kwankwani.  As a Babban Gona member, Saratu Mathew is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Saratu Mathew can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. 

However, Saratu Mathew is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, she will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will result in a yield of at least 60 bags of maize per hectare this season. She is hopeful about what the future holds; she hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, she will finally be able to afford to educate her children: Nashan and  Chris. Saratu Matthew’s dreams do not end here. "Ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs,” she expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income.

loans.name: Rebacca Dauda

texts.en:
Rebacca Dauda is a Babban Gona farmer from Kwankwani. Rebacca Dauda expressed that she is driven by one goal: "to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfill this ambition that led Rebacca Dauda to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, she finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. 

Like all Babban Gona members, Rebacca Dauda can earn up to $2,000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Rebacca Dauda is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 60 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, she will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. 

When asked what she plans to do with her income from this season, she said, “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.” With this loan, Rebacca Dauda will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a Babban Gona farmer from Kwankwani. Haruna expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Haruna to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. 

Like all Babban Gona members, Haruna can earn up to $2000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income.
