The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Haruna is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Haruna will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.” With this loan Haruna will be able to access all the inputs and services needed to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: to access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Ekomefeemo Group

texts.en:
The group Ekomefeemo will start its eighth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The group is comprised of six members and it is represented by Mary A. They are into businesses like selling smoked fish, plantains, yams, and scarves. 

This loan will benefit the small micro-businesses where Mary A. is a member. She says that four years ago, ID-Ghana was integrated into the group due to an invitation from a colleague that is a client of the institution. Now she has a business selling smoked fish. She actually began this business many years ago but was able to increase her sales by selling in the market.

Together with her friends she will take this loan to expand their businesses so as to satisfy customers better. She will buy four cartons of fish to smoke and sell to customers, and eventually improve her retail space. This work enables her to generate income so that she can support herself, since she is single with all her children grown up and living on their own.

When we asked what she liked about ID-Ghana, Mary A. responded that she likes the training offered.

loans.use: to buy four cartons of fish to smoke and sell to customers and to eventually improve her retail space.

loans.name: Vicuñitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VICUÑITAS” iniciará el décimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hortencia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de muebles, venta de sombreros, costura de deportivos, venta de jugo de naranja, taller de carpintería, venta de pescado, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hortencia es integrante, ella indica que es hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de taller de carpintería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo, quien trabajaba estos productos cuando era soltero, cuando se casaron decide implementar su taller independientemente. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de madera por mayor) que adquirirá de las barracas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank VICUÑITAS will begin its sixteenth cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Regional Hub of the Andes.  It is composed of eight partners and directed by a board of directors of which Hortencia is the president.  The businesses that the partners of the communal bank conduct are various, among which are: sales of furniture, sales of hats, sewing sports clothing, sales of orange juice, carpentry workshop, sales of fish, and food sales.
The loan they are seeking will benefit small microenterprises of which Hortencia is a partner.  She says that ten years ago she joined Pro Mujer, coming in at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution.  Today she has a carpentry workshop business.  She would like it to be known that she learned this business from her husband who used to make these products when he was single.  When they married, she decided to start her workshop independently.
The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital (purchase of wood wholesale) which she will get from the stalls in the city of El Alto and after the production she will market it to the customer's specifications.  This kind of work permits her to generate resources to help her family given that she is married and has three children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 47-year-old married mother of five children. She is a Palestinian refugee who has been working as a tailor since 1990. She lives and works in a Palestinian camp as a special occasions tailor where she rents and tailors women's special occasions dresses to support her family members.

Fatima is a hard worker who puts so much effort into improving and developing her business, and it is obvious, through the increasing number of customers. Fatima is applying her second loan cycle from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary clothes, textiles, and accessories to prepare for the wedding needs of her two precious daughters as her gift to them on their special occasions. Her previous loan was invested in buying a power generator and a new updated sewing machine which developed her business in a very impressive way.

Fatima hopes to stay capable of fulfilling her customers' needs and satisfying her family.

loans.use: to buy necessary clothes, textiles, and accessories to prepare for the wedding needs of her two precious daughters as her gift to them on their special occasions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of cassava.

loans.name: Hatice

texts.en:
Hatice is married and the mother of two. For 20 years she has run a hosiery shop very successfully. With some savings and loans she always changes her stock. With the loan from Maya, she will buy items for her shop. She is working hard to be able to pay her son’s university expenses and raise her living standards. She is well liked by her community.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Hatice Hanım,evli ve 2 çocuk annesi.  Hatice Hanım, 20 yıldır işlettiği tuhafiye dükkanında çok başarılı işler yapmış.  Küçük birikimlerle ve kullandığı kredilerle dükkanında ki malzemeleri sürekli çeşitlendirmiştir. Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile dükkanına malzeme alacak.  Üniversitede okuyan oğlunun masraflarını karşılayabilmek ve daha iyi standartlarda yaşayabilmek için tüm gayretiyle çalışan Hatice Hanım aynı zamanda çevresinde de çok seviliyor.

loans.use: to buy items for her shop.

loans.name: Asabe

texts.en:
Asabe is a 50-year-old farmer from Kwankwani.  As a Babban Gona member, Asabe is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Asabe can earn up to $2,000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. 

However, Asabe is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, she will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will result in a yield of at least 50 bags of maize per hectare this season. She is hopeful about what the future holds. She hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, she will finally be able to afford to educate her children: Abigail, Yusiya and  Keziya. Asabe’s dreams do not end here. “Ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs,” she said.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Atuwa Baturiya

texts.en: Atuwa Baturiya is a 28-year-old farmer from Kwankwani. As a Babban Gona member, Atuwa Baturiya is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Atuwa Baturiya can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Atuwa Baturiya is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, she will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season. Atuwa Baturiya is hopeful about what the future holds; she hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, she will finally be able to afford to educate her children Dantala and Blessing. Atuwa Baturiya’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs,” she expressed.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income.

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en: Magaji is a 50-year-old farmer from Kanakargo. As a Babban Gona member, Magaji is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Magaji can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Magaji is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will result in a yield of at least 80 bags of maize per hectare this season. Magaji is hopeful about what the future holds; he hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children. Magaji’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs,” he said.

loans.use: to access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Onua Do Group

texts.en:
The five female members of the Onua Do group are living in the same neighborhood. The women live in Teshie, a neighborhood of Accra. They know one another through family, neighborhood, and business connections. The group members sell charcoal, cassava dough, gari, ladies and gents tops, drinks, vegetables, foodstuff, and pastries.

All the women want to build up their stock holding so they work with the field partner, ID-Ghana. This will be their seventh group loan.

Mercy (standing in the middle of the photo) has a strong reputation for selling pastries and bread. She plans to use her loan to buy flour, margarine, flavor, sugar, salt, yeast, and milk to bake pastries and bread. She will resell it for cash to customers from house to house. Mercy expects to make a good monthly profit, which she will use to pay for the school and healthcare costs of her children and also repay the loan and save some.

loans.use: to buy flour, margarine, flavor, sugar, salt, yeast, and milk to bake pastries and bread.

loans.name: Angjelina

texts.en:
This is Angjelina, a 46-year-old villager who has been photographed with her most favorite pig, according to her. She is a married mother of five with the youngest one being 12 years old. Agriculture/livestock is what Angjelina practices and is very good at it. Currently she sells piglets from her pigs; eggs and hens from her chickens; corn, wheat, potatoes, onions, beans, and also seasonal veggies. While she takes care of her small agro-activity, her husband works for a pay nearly $389/month with the Navy Marine. 

Angjelina lives in a village that is known for its history. In 1703, an important assembly took place inside of a Catholic Church; the church still exists and is saved as a historic monument. 

Angjelina wants to add a dairy cow with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli is 52 years old. She lives in the small village of Orulu in the Zugdidi district with her husband, son and his family. Nanuli is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has a plot of agricultural land, where she grows different kinds of fruits and sells the harvest locally. 

Nanuli decided to purchase a cow and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 600 Gel. With the received credit she will purchase a cow and will start a dairy business. Nanuli will increase the income of the family and thus she will provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Tito Arnoldo

texts.es:
Tito de 51 años de edad,  estudio hasta sexto grado, en esos tiempos estudiar hasta ese grado era un universitario de ese tiempo, él es sastre desde sus 24 años aprendió el oficio, el que hoy es su fuente de ingreso principal, le enseño  un trabajador que vivía en la casa de su padre; su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres de la casa, sus hijos ya son adultos y cada quien tiene su hogar. Solo él y su esposa viven en casa.

Él  se dedica a la agricultura a pesar de su edad su buen estado de salud le ayuda a realizar sus actividades, ya tiene más de 35 años de dedicarse a la actividad productiva, fue su padre quien le enseño a trabajar. El trabajo lo tiene cerca de su casa, el recorrido lo hace a pie, sus hijos se involucran en la siembra, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 9:00 am.

El préstamo será invertido en el pago de personas que le ayuden con los trabajos más grandes, está cercando un sitio para encerrar sus aves de corral,  ya que así están más seguras, ya tiene todo lo que va a necesitar. La necesidad satisfecha es el poder hacer el trabajo que está pendiente.
texts.en:
Tito, 51 years old, studied until the sixth grade. In those times, studying to that grade was the university of that time. He has been a tailor from the age of 24 when he learned the trade, which today is his main source of income. A worker who lived in his father’s house taught him. His wife works on the household duties, and their children are already adults and each has their own home. Only he and his wife live in the house.

He works in agriculture, and despite his age, his good state of health helps him to carry out his activities. He already has more than 35 years of working in productive activity. It was his father who taught him to work. His work is close to home and he makes the rounds by foot. His children are involved in the sowing. His work schedule is 6:00am to 9:00am.

The loan will be invested in the payment of people who can help him with the bigger jobs. He is fencing a space to enclose his poultry, since they are safer that way. He already has everything he will need, and with this need satisfied, it is the ability to do the work that is pending.

loans.use: to pay people who can help him with the bigger jobs. He is fencing a space to enclose his poultry, since they are safer that way. He already has everything he will need.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu is a Babban Gona farmer from Kwankwani. Salamatu expressed that she is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfill this ambition that led Salamatu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, she finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Salamatu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Salamatu is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Salamatu will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what she plans to do with her income from this season, she said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.” With this loan, Salamatu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: to access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es: El señor Milton,  tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero, es una persona muy trabajadora se dedica a la crianza de pollos parrilleros en una granja, como un emprendimiento personal que le permite generar recursos económicos. Para este ciclo de crianza de pollos Milton incremento su capital productivo en cantidad de crianza de pollos sin embargo por el precio alto y mayor consumo de alimento se terminaron los insumos, por ello ahora solicita un crédito para la compra de alimento balanceado de engorde para la crianza de sus pollos. Su estabilidad económica sufrió un desequilibrio afectando directamente su adquisición de materiales e insumos requeridos. El señor es una persona responsable, quiere salir adelante con su propio esfuerzo, vive de forma independiente de sus padres  y trabaja arduamente fortaleciendo la actividad que tanto le gusta y generando recursos para cubrir sus gastos personales y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Milton, 23, is a very hardworking, single person who makes a living raising grilling chickens on a farm as a personal undertaking that permits him to generate economic resources.  For this chicken production cycle, Milton increased his chicken raising capital; however, due to the high price and the greater consumption of feed, his supplies ran out.   For this reason, he is requesting this loan to buy animal feed for fattening to raise his chickens.  His economic stability suffered a imbalance which directly affected his acquisition of required materials and supplies.  He is a responsible person and he wants to get ahead by his own means.  He lives independent of his parents and he works arduously fortifying the activity that he likes so much and generating the resources to cover his personal expenses and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for fattening to raise his chickens.

loans.name: Dúo Gardenias De Peronia Group

texts.es:
Dúo Gardenias de peronia
El cual esta conformado por la señora shery Julissa quien es madre de 1 una hija la cual cursa aun  la preparatoria y quien es propietaria de una mini farmacia ubicada en ciudad peronia la señora julissa tiene un poco mas de un año de tener su farmacia anteriormente ella solicito un crédito en el cual no tuvo ningún inconveniente en cancelarlo y con ello también pudo surtir su negocio ya que sueña y desea que cada día valla produciendo mas y mas en su negocio `pues esta consiente que cuesta pero ella con la ayuda de DIOS lograra levantarlo para que de esa forma pueda contribuir con su familia y poder lograr cada meta y sueño que tiene con su familia
texts.en:
The Peronia Gardenias Duo 

Señora Shery Julissa is the mother of a daughter who is in high school. She is also one half of the Peronia Gardenias partnership, which has operated a small pharmacy in the city of Peronia for a little more than a year. 

Señora Shery Julissa has previously applied for a loan and had no trouble repaying it; the funds from that loan allowed her to stock her pharmacy. Señora Shery Julissa aspires to boost sales in the pharmacy consistently. She knows that with the help of God, she will be able to support her family and achieve both her goals and those of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase medicinal products to sell in the pharmacy.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a Babban Gona farmer from Kwankwani. Emmanuel expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Emmanuel to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. 

Like all Babban Gona members, Emmanuel can earn up to $2000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Emmanuel, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 90 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Emmanuel will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.” With this loan Emmanuel will be able to access all the inputs and services needed to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Tarana is a Babban Gona farmer from Kwankwani. Tarana expressed that she is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Tarana to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, she finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Tarana can earn up to $2000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Tarana is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Tarana will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what she plans to do with her income from this season, she said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.” With this loan Tarana will be able to access all the inputs and services needed to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: to access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en: Hannatu lives in Kwankwani and is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfill this ambition that led her to join Babban Gona. Now, as a member, she finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and input from a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Hannatu can earn up to $2,000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. Our typical member grows 30 bags of maize/hectare, more than double the national average of 14. However, Hannatu is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, she will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what she plans to do with her income from this season, she said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland." With this loan, she will be able to access all the inputs and services she needs to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: to double her income and yield.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 60-year-old hardworking married woman who supports a family of nine children. Her husband earns additional income for their family while she runs a retail shop which has been in operation for ten years and brings her an income of KES. 10,000 at the end of every month. Jane is requesting her second loan of KES.45,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy more supplies for her store, including cooking fat, maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and detergents. Her goal is to boost her business by having additional and more varied items to sell. She plans to use the income she expects to earn to pay school fees for her children. Her goal is to become a successful businesswoman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her retail shop.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: El señor Rene y su esposa son personas jóvenes que solo alcanzaron a estudiar hasta el nivel primario por diversas circunstancias de la vida, viven en casa de su padre que es de construcción rustica y cuentan con dos niños pequeños dependientes económicos a su cargo, la actividad económica principal a la que se dedica es la producción agrícola, los productos que cultiva más son cebada, papa y trigo en terrenos de su padre, quien les brinda todo el apoyo. Rene y su familia viven en Tiraque, él es una persona responsable y trabajadora, pero para poder seguir trabajando por sus hijos y su familia tienen la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas que necesita para su producción, así podrá obtener  mayores beneficios e ingresos económicos que vayan a mejorar las condiciones  de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rene and his wife are young people who were only able to study until primary school because of different circumstances in their lives. They live in his father’s rustic-style house with their two young children for whom they are financially responsible. 

His principal economic activity is farming. He grows mostly barley, potatoes, and wheat on land that belongs to his father, who gives them all of his support. Rene and his family live in Tiraque.

He is a responsible, hardworking person, but in order to continue working for his children and his family, he needs to request a loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies that he needs for his crops. In this way, he will be able to achieve higher yields and income, which will improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Barnabas

texts.en:
Barnabas is a 55-year-old farmer from Kwankwani. As a Babban Gona member, Barnabas, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Barnabas can earn up to $2000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Barnabas is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will result in a yield of at least 60 bags of maize per hectare this season. Barnabas is hopeful about what the future holds - he hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Ezekiel and Mathew. Barnabas' dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs,” he expressed.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as rice, salt, oil, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise, shirts, athletic shorts, and pants for men.

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru: Чолпон 31 год, замужем, 2 детей. С 2005 года занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день Чолпон смогла развить свою деятельность, у нее есть 4 коровы, 1 лошадь и 25 овец. Сено для скота заготавливает самостоятельно. Супруг активно и с удовольствием помогает по хозяйству. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет примерно 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса Чолпон обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Чолпон планирует направить на покупку скота, а также в скором будущем хочет построить сарай.
texts.en: Cholpon is 31 and married with two children. She has been working in animal husbandry since 2005 and wants to develop her business, which currently includes four cows, one horse and 25 sheep, and hay for feed, which she prepares on her own. Her husband is happy to help her with her business, which currently brings in about 10,000 KGS per month. With the goal of further developing her business, Cholpon has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy heifers to increase her head count of livestock. She plans to use profits from the loan to buy more livestock as well as to build a barn in the future.

loans.use: to purchase heifers

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор родилась в 1977 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. У нее очень дружная семья. Гулбахор уже несколько лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Она выращивает в основном лук и ячмень. Гулбахор имеет 1.5 га земли, где упорно работает каждый день. Она должна сделать второй посев и ей необходимо для этого купить минеральные удобрения. Гулбахор запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки минерального удобрения. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulbahor was born in 1977 and is married with two children. She has a very loving family. For quite a few years already, she has been working in agriculture. She grows mostly onions and barley on a 1.5 hectare plot of land where she works consistently every day. Gulbahor needs to do another planting and has to buy mineral fertilizers. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy these fertilizers. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Claudia Darlin

texts.es: La señora Claudia tiene veinte años de edad proviene  de una familia humilde y trabajadora dedicada a la actividad de comercio vive en la zona de Quillacollo, tiene dos hermanas, actualmente todas están viviendo en la casa de sus padres, donde decidió abrir una tienda de barrio para que salga adelante en su vida ya que en las noches está estudiando para ser profesional y darle la satisfacción a su madre quien se siente orgullosa por el esfuerzo de su hija. Parte de su ingreso es otorgado a su padre quien está  pasando por problemas de salud, pero actualmente se encuentra en etapa de recuperación. Por la buena atención que realiza su mercado está en constante crecimiento por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de mercadería para su tienda, con esto generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Claudia is 20 years old.  She comes from a humble and hardworking family, dedicated to a sales business.  She lives in the area of Quillacollo, and has two sisters.  Currently they are all living in her parents' house, where she decided to open a neighborhood store so that she can advance in her life while at night, she is studying to be a professional and satisfy her mother who is proud for the efforts of her daughter.  Part of their income goes to her father who is having health problems, but now is in a recovery state.  For the good care of her store, it is constantly growing and for that she is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise for her store.  With this, she will earn better income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en: Loise lives in Kwankwani and is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfill this ambition that led her to join Babban Gona. Now, as a member, she finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and the expertise of a trained agronomist. Like all of our members, Loise can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. By producing the average output for a Babban Gona member of 30 bags of maize/hectare this season, she will be yielding double the national average of 14. This will provide her with enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what she plans to do with her income from this season, she said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland." With this loan, she will be able to access all the inputs and services she needs to make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to double her income and yield.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is 28 years old. She is from Magurmari village in Dhupguri, which is in a remote region in Jalpaiguri district. She is married to Swapan, 31 years  old. Sabita studied until grade seven and her husband has a secondary education.  Together they are raising only one daughter who reads in grade one.

Sabita's husband is a farmer. Sabita is a very hardworking woman who pursues the domestic duties in her home and also helps her husband in his agricultural activities. Along with her partner, she grows potatoes, beans, bottle gourds, chilies etc. They developed this business many years ago and  she learned along with him. The land they cultivate together is their own, acquired with much effort and sacrifice.

Like other cultivators, her plans for the future are to expand her property and grow other vegetables, which will allow her to grow with her business and with her family.  She wants to cultivate paddy, which is an all-season crop in much demand by the local people.

She is applying for financing from BJS to purchase agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizers, manure etc. to start cultivation as early as possible. She hopes she will get an excellent result from this. She wants to use her income to support her daughter in her studies, since that is the best inheritance that she can offer to her.

She also aspires to purchase more agricultural lands in future with the profit.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Oykhumor

texts.ru: Ойхумор 35 летняя жительница не большого района под названием Пяндж. Она замужем, муж работает на стройке рабочим. У них двое маленьких детей. Ойхумор не имеет высшего образования, но она работает и приносит в дом хороший источник дохода. Ойхумор в течение нескольких лет занимается животноводством. Она покупает, откармливает и продает крупнорогатых скотин. Ойхумор в этой деятельности не первый год и считает, что пора уже расширять бизнес. Она просит кредит, чтобы купить несколько голов скотин и увеличить поголовья скотов. По ее прогнозам у Ойхумор вскоре будет большое количество скота, и увеличиться доходность.
texts.en: Oykhumor is a 35-year-old resident of a small region called Pyandj. She is married with two small children. Her husband works in construction. Oykhumor doesn't have a higher education, but she works and brings a good income into her home. For several years she has been working in animal husbandry, buying, fattening and selling cattle. Now that she has gained some experience she things it's time to expand her business. She is requesting a loan to buy a few head of cattle to increase her head count. She believes that once she has increased her number of livestock, her income will increase accordingly.

loans.use: to buy a few head of cattle in order to expand her business

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Земля является основным источником бизнеса и основной кормилицей в Таджикистане. Многие люди в примере  Матлубы  занимаются земледелием и получают доход для проживания.   Матлубы  более 30  лет занимается выращиванием виноградника. Ей 52 года. Она замужем и имеет одного совершеннолетнего сына.  Она выращивает виноград в арендованной земле, и полученный урожай продает на местном рынке. Она планирует развевать бизнес, но  не имеет денег для покупки  минерального удобрения и оплаты аренды земли. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: The land is the primary source of business and income in Tajikistan. Many people such as Matluba earn a living through agriculture. For more than 30 years, Matluba has been growing grapes. She is 52 and married with one adult son. She grows her grapes on rented land and sells the harvest at the local market. She plans to develop her business but doesn't have enough money to buy mineral fertilizers or to pay for land rental. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and to pay for land rental

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 31 years old, strong, full of energy and hardworking, and hails from the Kitale area of Kenya, a place that is blessed with good weather patterns and is one of the best areas on earth to practice farming. David has a wife and two children that he really admires and would do anything for so that they never lack anything. Through practicing dairy and crop farming, he has always been able to provide food for his family and also meet their basic needs. He has acquired much experience over the last five years, and this has helped him earn profits. He is seeking a loan for KES 40,000 to buy poultry and through the loan he is sure that he will satisfy the demand for poultry products in Kitale which is densely populated and has ready markets for eggs and poultry. Because of the immense knowledge that David has, and also because of the good will he enjoys with the villagers, he will not have any challenge in selling his products and also believes that through word of mouth he will be able to get more customers and increase his customer base. Increased profit levels will translate into better living conditions for David and his family and this will also allow him to make permanent changes to his life and increase his business.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Celjeta

texts.en:
Celjeta wants to buy a milk cow with the loan she is requesting from Kiva lenders.

Celjeta is 29-years-old and is a married mother of 9-year-old who was born with disabilities and a 5-year old. While her husband looks after their son she practices agriculture/livestock in order to earn an income.  At the moment, she has one cow and grapevines. She sells raw milk and grapes to the local market of a nearby coastal town. Here is what Celjeta said during the loan interview with the loan officer: “adding another cow will improve our income, because we spend a lot of money for our son. We get a disability income for him and for my husband as the caretaker; yet, the expenses for our son are increasing considerably as he grows in age.”

Celjeta will be very appreciative of your financial help.

loans.use: to buy another milk cow.

loans.name: Afiniki

texts.en:
Afiniki is a maize farmer from Kwankwani.  As a Babban Gona member, Afiniki is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Afiniki can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. 

However, Afiniki is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, she will be able to access quality materials such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of close to 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Afiniki is hopeful about what the future holds; she  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, she will finally be able to afford to educate her children: Lucy,  Linus, and  Godwin. Afiniki’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, she said.

loans.use: to access high quality materials such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Chrispus

texts.en:
Chrispus is a 61-year-old married man who supports a family of four children and his wife adds additional income to cater for their family welfare.  Chrispus has been operating a motorcycle business for a period of thirteen years earning an income of KES.10,000 at the end of every month.

Chrispus is now servicing his second loan with Kiva partner VisionFund Kenya and he intends to use this amount to add to his savings to buy an additional motorcycle.  He plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to buy a mini bus to facilitate transport for his customers who travel out of his to other nearby towns.

loans.use: to add to his savings in order to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Nachima

texts.en:
Nachima is a housewife from the small town of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district. She is only 24 years old and lives with her husband Samidar and two children (one son and one daughter) in a kaccha house (made of mud, bamboo and straw). Both attended school until the seventh standard and could not continue due to poverty.  Their children are too young for school.

Her husband has been involved in farming for many years and cultivates many kinds of vegetables to sell in the village market. He works from dawn to dusk on his farmland to cultivate good quality products, yet his earning are insufficient for the family.  Due to his low income, Nachima is unable to manage her family expenses properly .Her husband is struggling as best he can, but fails to make more income than expected. So they have decided to cultivate paddy, which is a profitable crop.

Nachima requested from BJS (Kiva’s Partner) a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivation of paddy in the same field to enhance the family income. She is very much ambitious and hopeful that she will succeed at her target of more income. She dreams that she will construct a better and decent house with her business profit in the future.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for making her self–sufficient.

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Basabi

texts.en:
Basabi is a very young lady of only 26 years. She is married to Subhash. They have three children (one son and two daughters). Basabi is a homemaker and is illiterate. She can only sign her name. Her husband has a secondary education. Two of their children are students in different grades in primary school; the third one is too young for school. They have a small kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo) in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Basabi's husband is a farmer and earns a living by farming green vegetables like chili, cabbages and different vegetables in different seasons on their plot of land. She and her husband work hard and always grow high quality products that they sell in the local market to make their livelihood. She needs to expand her existing business to give additional financial support to her family. She thought of cultivating paddy on their land, which is a vegetable that is in great demand in West Bengal and used as the staple food.

Basabi heard that BJS gives loans to rural women for their businesses. She has taken a loan from them to purchase high quality paddy seeds and fertilizers to start cultivation.

Her dream is to improve the family's finances and to secure her children's career with the profit generated from this business.

She also aspires to purchase more land in the future to grow their business.

She is very grateful to BJS and Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for paddy cultivation

loans.name: Nurbanu

texts.en:
Nurbanu is a young lady of only 23 years. She is married, a housewife and studied until grade five. She lives with her husband Nur Amin, 27 years old. He also attended school up to the fifth standard. They are raising their two children (one son and one daughter). One of them attends school and is in grade one and the other is too young for school. They live in their own house in Vemtia, a remote village in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Nurbanu's husband is associated with the business of cultivation of vegetables on their farmland. He learned to grow vegetables at a very young age by watching his parents. He gives his best effort to grow good vegetables to satisfy his customers and meet the family's expenses. When harvest time comes, Nurbanu helps him. Now they have decided to expand their business and cultivate paddy. They have chosen this crop because it is the main food for most of the people of West Bengal.

Nurbanu is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seeds and fertilizers and wants to start paddy cultivation. She hopes that this business will help her a lot, because with the earnings, she will be able to manage the household expenses.

Her dreams are to continue helping her husband by improving the business, to support her children improve academically, and upgrade their house to a decent and better one with all the basic facilities.

She thanks BJS and Kiva for giving their support.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs like seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of paddy.

loans.name: Mayna

texts.en:
Mayna lives in the small village of Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri with her husband and two daughters. She is a 22-year-old housewife who has a 9th grade education. Both their daughters are too young for school. They have a small kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo-made).

Mayna's husband Rajen, 24 years old, is a farmer with five years of experience running his agricultural business. He grows different seasonal vegetables in their ancestral land. Mayna helps her husband in his agricultural work. The gathered harvest is sold locally and the family somehow manages to support itself.

Mayna and her husband would like to enlarge their agricultural business in order to give a better lifestyle to their family. Their income is not sufficient to cover all the expenses of a family of four members, especially in these days when the price of everything is going up.

Mayna has taken a loan from BJS to purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers, so that she can start farming paddy, which is a very important crop and is used in most of the states in India. They hope that this will be a very lucrative business.

Mayna is an enthusiastic and hardworking woman who does her best to have a successful and profitable business with which they can fulfill their dreams.

Mayna aspires to upgrade their house to a concrete-made house with the profit from her business.

She is very much thankful to her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for the financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies to cultivate paddy.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a 22-year-old entrepreneur from the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe.  Anna has been selling clothes for the past six months. When she is not working, Anna serves as a Camfed Learner Guide and mentors young students. With the Kiva loan, Anna intends to make bulk purchases of clothes and boost her sales and profits. She hopes to focus on her education with the profits she will earn.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant potatoes

loans.name: Izatbegim

texts.ru:
Изатбегим пожилая жительница предгорного района А.Джоми, где основной деятельностью жителей этой местности является животноводство и растениеводство. Изатбегим на протяжении 30 лет занимается скотоводческим делом, который приносит ей не только доход, но и удовольствие. Семья помогает ей в этом деле. 
Изатбегим вдова и живет вместе с детьми, невестками и внуками. Ей 73 года и она все еще активно занимается выращиванием коров. Сейчас ей необходимо немного денежных средств, чтобы приобрести еще одну корову и увеличить поголовье скота. Она надеется на этот кредит.
texts.en:
Izatbegim is an elderly resident of the hilly A. Jomi region, where the majority of people work in agriculture and animal husbandry. For 30 years she has been raising livestock, which brings her not only income, but also enjoyment. Her family helps her with this work.

Izatbegim is a widow and lives with her children, their spouses and her grandchildren. She is 73 and still works actively taking care of the cattle. Now she needs some money in order to buy one more cow and increase her head count. She is counting on this loan.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru:
Азиза жительница района Спитамен. Ей 29 лет. Она замужем. Её муж работает за рубежом. Азиза пока живет вместе с двумя дочерьми. Она уже четыре с половиной года занимается торговлей. Каждый день она выходит на рынок вместе с младшей дочерью. Азиза занимается торговлей женского нижнего белья. 
Азиза берет кредит для приобретения сезонного товара, женского нижнего белья. Она намерена также увеличить ассортимент товара.
texts.en: Aziza is a resident of the Spitamen region. She is 29 and married, and her husband works abroad. Aziza lives with her two daughters and has been working in retail for four and a half years. Every day she goes to the market with her youngest daughter and sells women's lingerie. Aziza is requesting a loan to buy seasonal women's undergarments and increase her assortment of merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase women's undergarments for resale

loans.name: Muharrama

texts.ru:
Мухаррама проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 23 года. Она очень гостеприимная и отзывчивая женщина. Мухаррама живет одна вместе с дочерью. Она на протяжении четырех лет занимается торговлей. Торговле она научилась у матери. На сегодняшний день у Мухаррамы смешанный ассортимент товара. Но в основном она продает женскую одежду и детскую обувь. 
Мухаррама берет кредит для приобретения сезонного товара.
texts.en: Muharrama lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 23 and a very hospitable and responsible woman who lives with her daughter. Muharrama has been working in retail for four years, a trade she learned from her mother. Right now she has a wide assortment of goods but sells primarily women's clothing and children's shoes. She is requesting a loan to buy seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to buy seasonal shoes and women's clothing for resale

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 53 years old and has nine children. Alicia is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Alicia is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Alicia has been in pig fattening for 30 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Magajiya

texts.en:
Magajiya is a 50-year-old farmer from Kwankwani. As a Babban Gona member, Magajiya, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Magajiya can earn up to $2000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Magajiya is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, she will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.

Magajiya is hopeful about what the future holds; she hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, she will finally be able to afford to educate her children; Isiya and Adamu. Magajiya’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs,” she expressed.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is a 30-year-old widow who is a mother of two sons. They live in their own small house in the village of Sarkarpara in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Minati lost her husband a few years ago.  From then until now, she has had to look after her sons and earn for the family.  She has to struggle a lot to earn income for her family. Her sons are students. One is in grade eight and the other is in grade five. 

Her husband was a small farmer who used to grow seasonal vegetables on their own farmland. They had to face so many challenges in life, including inadequate capital to successfully carry out his business activity and inadequate finances to educate their children and provide them with other basic necessities. 

After her husband's death, Minati has been continuing the business. But the income from the agricultural activities is hardly sufficient for maintaining all the expenses of her family. So, she has decided to cultivate paddy, as it has a very good market demand.

Minati has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to fulfill her purpose. She will use the loan to buy paddy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for growing paddy on their own field. It is a crop that is in great demand all over West Bengal. She holds a positive view of succeeding with this business.

With the additional profit from this business, she will be able to fulfill the basic necessities of her family and give a higher education to her children. In the future, she dreams of buying more lands with the profit from her business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers for growing paddy.

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.ru:
Гулчахон жительница района Шахритус. Ей 21 года. Она не замужем. Гулчахон приятная в общении девушка. Более трех лет Гулчахон занимается торговлей. Она продает женскую и мужскую одежду. Этим видом деятельности Гулчахон занимается три года. В торговле ей помогают ее брат и сестра. 
Гулчахон берет кредит для приобретения женской одежды и мужского нижнего белья.
texts.en: Guljahon is a resident of the Shahrituz region. She is 21 and not married. Guljahon is a pleasant and personable young woman who has been working in retail for more than three years. She sells women's and men's clothing. Her brother and sister help her with the shop. She is requesting a loan to buy women's clothing and men's underwear.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing and men's undergarments for resale

loans.name: Mayniso

texts.ru: Эту добрую и общительную женщину с района Вахш зовут Майнисо. Ей 50 лет и она занимается собственным любимым делом. Вот уже 5 лет как Майнисо предоставляет услуги швеи у себя дома. Она в основном принимает заказы на пошив женских платьев национального покроя. Благодаря доходу от деятельности она обеспечивает свою семью, которая состоит из ее самой и ее троих дочерей. Все дочери унаследовали от матери способность к шитью и усердно помогают матери в ее швейном бизнесе. Сейчас Майнисо решила расширить свою деятельность и с такой целью обратилась за кредитом. Она хочет приобрести новую швейную машинку и надеется на вашу финансовую поддержку. Этот кредит ей очень важен.
texts.en:
This kind and sociable woman from the Vakhsh region is called Mayniso. She is 50 and earns a living through her favourite work, offering sewing services from her home, a business she has had for five years. For the most part she takes orders for women's dresses in the national style. Thanks to income from her work she is able to care for her family, which consists of herself and her three daughters, all of whom have learned to sew from their mother and help her with her business. 

Now, Mayniso has decided to expand her business and is requesting a loan for this purpose. She wants to buy a new sewing machine and hopes for your financial support. This loan is very important to her.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to expand her sewing business

loans.name: Zulola

texts.ru: Одной из жительниц района Гиссар 40 лет. Ее зовут Зулола. Она замужем и воспитывает троих детей. Зулола в течение 7 лет работает в школе преподавателем. И параллельно со школой она дома занимается земледелием. У нее имеется несколько плодовых деревьев, а так же она каждый год сажает новый урожай. И на данный момент ней необходимо закончить посеянный урожай и обработать их минеральными удобрениями. С этой целью она обратилась за кредитом, на денежные средства она приобретет минеральные удобрения и семена.
texts.en: Zulola, a resident of the Gissar region, is 40 and married with three children. She has been working as a schoolteacher for seven years and maintains a side business in agriculture as well. She has a few fruit trees and plants crops every year as well. At the moment, she needs to help along the current harvest with mineral fertilizers. With this goal in mind she is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn, wood, lime and bags

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en: Marieta is 26 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, Marieta works very hard to provide for them. Marieta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to resell in her general store. Marieta has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, sugar, juice, detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, etc. In the future, Marieta would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Zebuniso

texts.ru: Зебунисо живет в селе района А.Джоми. В течение 15 лет она и ее семья активно занимаются растениеводством. У них имеется небольшой участок приусадебной земли, на котором она выращивают все виды овощей. Сейчас на их землях посеяна капуста, урожай которого уже созрел. Зебунисо и ее семья занимаются сбором урожая капусты и теперь на ее место собираются посеять помидор, огурец и картофель. Однако для этой цели у них не хватает финансовых средств и поэтому Зебунисо обратилась за кредитом, чтобы провести очередной посев. На сумму кредита Зебунисо хочет купить семена помидора, огурца и картофеля. Она ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Zebuniso lives in a village in the A. Jomi region. She and her family have been working in agriculture for 15 years. They have a small plot of land on which she grows all kinds of vegetables. Right now they have cabbage planted, and it is ready to be harvested. Zebuniso and her family have been harvesting the cabbage and in its place they want to plant potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers. However, she doesn't have enough money to do this and for this reason she is requesting a loan so she can plant again. She wants to buy tomato and cucumber seeds and seed potatoes with the loan funds. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy tomato and cucumber seeds and seed potatoes

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget is a 20-year-old businesswoman from the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been selling clothes for the past five months. Bridget started her business to become financially independent. During her spare time, Bridget volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide and helps school children every week with their studies. With the requested loan, Bridget intends to buy more clothes to sell so that she can earn more profits. With the additional profits, she would like to meet the financial needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Санавбар очень трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Она вдова и имеет одну дочку. Санавбар родилась в 1954 году. Она опытная портниха. Санавбар уже более 30 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она шьет женскую одежду по заказу. Санавбар предоставляет свои услуги местным жителям у себя дома, так как ее мастерская находится у нее дома. Санавбар является единственным кормильцем семьи. Она уже давно хочет купить мягкую мебель для своего дома, но не имеет достаточно денег для этого. Санавбар запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки мебели. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Sanavbar is a very hardworking and conscientious woman who was born in 1954. She is a widow and has one daughter. Sanavbar is an experienced seamstress who has been sewing women's clothing to order for more than 30 years. She offers her services to others in her area from her home, since that's where she has her studio. Sanavbar is the only income-earner in her household. She has been wanting to buy furniture for her home for a long time, but doesn't have enough money. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy furniture. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru:
Санавбар жительница района Рудаки. Ей 38 лет. Она честная и воспитанная женщина. У нее среднее образование. Санавбар проживает с матерью и детьми. У нее пятеро детей.
Санавбар занимается торговлей. Она занялась бизнесом после того как развелась с мужем. Вот уже три года как Санавбар открыла свой собственный продуктовый магазин. У Санавбар в магазине работает продавщица, кроме нее еще ей помогают ее дети. 
Санавбар берет кредит для покупки продуктов, чтобы запастись. Так как перед праздником "Иди Рамадан" спрос на продукты питания увеличивается. Она не хочет потерять клиентов.
texts.en:
Sanavbar is a resident of the Rudaki region. She is 38 and an honest and well brought up woman. She has a high school education and lives with her mother and five children.

Sanavbar works in retail, a business she started in after divorcing her husband. For three years now she has had her own grocery store. She has one employee and her children help as well.

Sanavbar is requesting a loan to buy food products to stock her shelves, since demand for groceries increases before the "Idi Ramadan" holiday (which marks the end of Ramadan). She doesn't want to lose customers.

loans.use: to buy food products to stock her shop

loans.name: Mollen

texts.en: Mollen is a 27-year-old woman from the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. As a Camfed Learner Guide, she volunteers once a week at a local school teaching life skills to students. To earn a living Mollen operates a small grocery shop; she sells essentials to people in her community. Mollen would like to increase her stock and expand her inventory. She would use the Kiva loan to purchase more groceries in bulk to reduce her costs and increase her profits. This will help her provide for her family and create a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like cooking oil, soap, salt and royco in bulk.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Nicolás, vive y trabaja en Tiraque, económicamente es independiente, trabajador y responsable; se dedica a la agricultura y siembra papa, haba, oca  y avena forrajera como sus principales productos en terreno propio con una extensión de 3 hectáreas en la misma comunidad.  Produce con rotación de cultivos, tiene una experiencia de 28 años en el sector agrícola, además cuenta con cabezas de ganado 2 de engorde y 2 lecheras. Actualmente requiere un crédito para la compra de 1.5 camiones de abono orgánico(gallinaza), 10 cargas de semilla de papa para la siembra y productos agroquímicos, ya que quiere proveerse de estos insumos  agrícolas porque se acerca la época de siembra y con ellos incrementará su producción  y tendrá mayores ventas que mejorarán su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Nicolás, who lives and works in Tiraque, is financially independent, hardworking and responsible; he works in agriculture and grows potatoes, lima beans, yams, and oat fodder as his main products on his own land, with an area of 3 hectares in the same community.  He produces a rotation of crops and has 28 years of experience in the agriculture industry.  In addition, he has livestock, two for cattle and two for dairy.  He currently needs a credit for the purchase of 1.5 trucks of organic fertilizer (manure), 10 loads of potato seeds for planting and agrochemical products.  He hopes to have these agricultural inputs for the planting season that is approaching and with them, he will increase his production and have more sales that will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase 1.5 trucks of organic fertilizer (manure), 10 loads of potato seeds for planting and agrochemical products.

loans.name: Derentina

texts.en:
Derentina is 44 years old and her profession for earning an income is seamstress. She has two school-aged children, 16 and 12. Her husband runs a transportation motor cart to earn a living. She is requesting this loan because lately she hasn’t been feeling well and wants to go for some medical checkups and visitation to a health care specialist. She and her husband both have clients for the services they run. 

Derentina and her family live in the city of Korca where  even today some residents speak their own languages due to their heritage, such as Slavic, Rumanian, Greek and Macedonian. These minorities have always lived in harmony with one another, despite the fact that the dictatorship up until the 90s was very harsh and did not allow these languages to be spoken freely or customs to be followed accordingly.

loans.use: to pay for her medical expenses

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce, 36, is married and a mother of three from the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She has been gardening since 2011. On her farmland, she grows tomatoes, cabbages, and potatoes. Joyce volunteers as a life skills educator and counselor at the local school. She also assists the elderly in her community with their chores. Joyce will use the Kiva loan to buy pesticides, seeds and a fence for one of the gardens. Her wish is to be a commercial farmer in her area.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, seeds and a fence for one of the gardens.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро добродушная женщина. Она живет на севере Таджикистана. Зухро замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж Хусейн. Зухро 6 лет назад начала свой бизнес шитьем и продажей занавесок. Она покупает ткани из столицы, шьет красивые занавески и продает на местном рынке. Зухро с бизнесом справляется сама. Она постепенно год за годом развевает свой бизнес. Зухро хочет купить новые виды тканей и для этого ей необходимо съездить в столицу. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки ткани для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zuhro is a kindhearted woman who lives in the north of Tajikistan. She is married and has two children. Her husband's name is Huseyn. Six years ago, Zuhro started a business sewing and selling curtains. She buys fabric from the capital city, sews beautiful curtains and sells them at the local market. She works on this business by herself and has been developing it gradually year by year. Zuhro wants to buy new kinds of fabric and needs to go to the capital to do so. She is requesting a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy fabric to increase her working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her business sewing and selling curtains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: will use the money to buy enough meat and flour.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 41-years-old. He is married to Carolyn and together they have been blessed with four children aged between 18 and 4 years.

Julius is a carpenter, a business he has done for the last 17 years earning a monthly income of Kshs. 50,000. He enjoys his business and thus has requested a loan of Kshs. 45,000 from Kiva partner VisionFund Kenya in order to purchase carpentry materials such as wood.

Julius will use the profits from the loan to improve the standard of living of his family.This is his second loan after successfully repaying his previous loan.

Julius hopes and dreams of lifting his business to the next level in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wood for carpentry.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 24-year-old woman from the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe who is very passionate about her business. A happily married mother of three, she has been operating a poultry business from her home. Cecilia keeps traditional chickens producing about 40 birds every cycle.

With this requested Kiva loan, Cecilia would like to expand her fowl run and buy feed for her chickens. Her dream is to see her enterprise blossom and employ more people, while also taking good care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks to sell.

loans.name: Nurjahan

texts.en:
Nurjahan hails from Dhupguri. She is a young, energetic and active entrepreneur of 46 years.  She lives with her husband and one son in the small village of Dangapara in Jalpaiguri district. Nurjahan's husband Abdul, 54 years old, is a land cultivator by profession. Nurjahan and her husband both have an elementary education. Due to poor economic conditions, they could not provide an education to their only son who is now working with his father in his agribusiness.

Nurjahan's husband, together with their son, cultivates different crops on their farmland.  Their meager income cannot cover all the necessary expenses for the family. Because of the scarcity of financial resources, Nurjahan has always been forced to look for the other revenue sources. So, for the last few years she has been raising cows. She supplies cow's milk to her neighborhood.  She is now an important financial support for the family.  She has only one cow in her herd. But in order to improve her dairy business, she wants to purchase one more cow, which will provide her with more milk to sell. Nurjahan and her family really need financial support to realize their goals.

So, she has asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy one more dairy cow. She will supply milk to more clients not only to satisfy the demand of her customers but to strengthen the family's economy.  She hopes to save money little by little from the profit generated to construct a better house for them.

She is thankful for both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.ru: Фазилат является одной из тех женщин, которые стараются обеспечить семью со всеми необходимыми средствами. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Она занимается скотоводством уже более 20 лет. Фазилат откармливает крупно-рогатого скота. Она откармливает скот у себя дома, так как имеет большой коровник у себя дома. Она планирует отремонтировать свой старый дом и поэтому она обратилась за займом в сумме 7500 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Fazilat is one of those women who try to take care of their families in every way possible. She is married with two children and her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. She has been working in animal husbandry for more than 20 years, fattening cattle at home where she has a large cowshed. She plans to fix up her old house and is requesting a loan of 7,500 to do so. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Komila

texts.ru: Комила окончила строительный техникум по специальности гидрометр. После замужества она была вынуждена уйти с работы и организовать бизнес скотоводством, так как ее зарплата была маленькая. Комила уже в течение многих лет откармливает коров и продает местным жителям молоко и молочные продукты. Доход от продажи молока, способствует улучшению питания для детей и тем самым обеспечивает здоровый и полноценный образ жизни. Она имеет 3 детей, старшая дочь учится в колледже и в свободное время помогает матери по скотоводству.  Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Она не отправляет деньги регулярно. Поэтому Комила особо не надеется на денежные переводы от мужа и старается во всем справляться сама. В этом году они с мужем решили строить новый дом, но так как строительство нового дома требует больших затрат, она обратилась в ИМОН за займом в сумме 10000 сомони для покупки цемента, кирпича и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Komila graduated from technical school with a specialty in hydrometry. After getting married she had to leave her profession and start an animal husbandry business, since her salary was so small. She has been feeding cows and selling milk and dairy products for many years. Income from this business helps her to improve her children's diet and to offer them a healthy and fulfilling quality of life. Komila has three children; the oldest daughter studies in college and helps her mother with the animals in her free time. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia who doesn't send money regularly. Therefore Komila doesn't depend on money sent from her husband and tries to take care of herself. This year she and her husband decided to build a new house, but since it's an expensive endeavour, she has turned to IMON for a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy cement, bricks and other necessary materials. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and other construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods such as palatine, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 50-year-old farmer from Kiyawa.  As a Babban Gona member, Esther is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Esther can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Esther is ambitious and is aiming to reap 36 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make as a Babban Gona member, her said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Danyaya, Abubakar, and  Rahila. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Beaulah

texts.en:
Beaulah is 32 years old and a mother of two children. She lives in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. 

She has been running a gardening business since last year. She sells tomatoes, leafy green vegetables, and onions to her community. Beaulah also volunteers as a life skills educator at the local secondary school where she helps improve learning outcomes for students. 

With a loan from Kiva, Beaulah would like to buy seeds, herbicides, and fertilizers for her garden so that she can increase her yield. The improvements of her yield will enable her to support her family and the vulnerable children in her community.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair and refurbish a mobile grill cart.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a dairy unit.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima, a 32-year-old lady, lives in Magurmari village in Dhupguri with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter). Due to her parental monetary problems, she has attended school up to grade four only, but she is much concerned with her children’s education. All of her children are studying in different grades.

Her husband is a farmer who cultivates seasonal vegetables and sells them to the local market. After managing the household work, she helps her husband to plow their farmland but the net household income is not sufficient for her to bear the cost of the household expenses as well as the children’s educational expenses. 
 
Purnima decided to cultivate bitter gourd, as this vegetable is a medicinal food for diabetics and has many other health benefits. Now Purnima applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva partner’s) to purchase seeds and fertilizers to start cultivating bitter gourd. She hopes the profit she will gain will help to increase her family’s financial status. She dreams of building a concrete house in the future with the profit from her business.

She is greatly obliged to her lenders Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies like seeds, pesticides and fertilizers for bitter gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Nyonko Group

texts.en:
The Nyonko Do 1 group consists of five persons, whose members reside in the same locality. They are into fresh fish, materials, cloth, lining, eggs, noodles, bread, charcoal, and second hand clothing. 

The representative for the group, Charity, is 33 years old and is married to Billy. She lives with her ​​husband and their two children, both attending school and under their care.  The couple deals together with all the family's diverse needs.

For the past four years Charity has been selling noodles, eggs, and bread. This activity allows her to contribute towards her family's needs. This is the first time Charity and the other members of the Nyonko Do 1 group have sought a loan from ID-Ghana. It will enable them to strengthen their business and better meet their customers' needs.

loans.use: To buy noodles, eggs, and bread to sell to customers

loans.name: Rinku

texts.en:
Rinku is a 26-year-old housewife from Dhupguri.  She is married with Tapan, 30 years old. Together with her husband, she is raising two children (one son and one daughter). One of their children attends school and the other is too young for school. They live in the small village of Baroghoria in Jalpaiguri district.  Both Rinku and her husband have a primary education.

Rinku's husband operates a grocery shop at his locality. She manages her household and looks after her husband and children.  He sells rice, oil, sugar, salt, biscuits and other kinds of daily necessities.  However, with his current income, it's getting difficult to manage the household expenses, pay school fees and save adequately for their future.  So he wants to increase their inventory and cater to more customers.  With this loan, Rinku and her husband will be able to purchase more stocks.

So Rinku has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to help her husband. She hopes this will help them steadily grow their small grocery and increase their monthly profit. This will help her family to get a financially secure and stable future.  She wants to purchase land of their own with the profit generated

She is thankful to her generous lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her husband's grocery store.

loans.name: Revai

texts.en:
Revai is an 18-year-old businesswoman from the Mudzi District in Zimbabwe. She has been successfully buying and selling clothes for over ten months. She sells jackets, shirts, skirts, and dresses. When she is not working in the flea market, Revai volunteers every week as a Learner Guide at the local secondary school assisting students with their studies.  

With a Kiva loan, Revai intends to make bulk clothing purchases to reduce costs and increase sales. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business, enable her to further her education, and provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy enough goods such as rice, seasoning cubes, oil, salt, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Idi

texts.en: Idi remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Idi, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Idi  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family” expressed Idi. With this loan, Idi is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Dúo Manos Ayudadoras Group

texts.es:
DUO MANOS AYUDADORAS
