La señora Maria Celeste de 48 años, soltera,  desde hace 5 años posee una Tortillería ubicada en la calle principal de la colonia San Rafael Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de la señora María Elena poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar Maíz para seguir creciendo con su tortillería.
texts.en:
DUO MANOS AYUDADORAS

Maria Celeste is 48 years old. She is single. For five years, she has had a tortilla factory on the main street of San Rafael Chimaltenango. Due to her efforts, she has established and improved her home. Through her business, she has maintained and moved her family ahead. 
Maria's dream is to improve the quality of life for herself and her family through the micro-loan she is requesting from FAPE. With the loan, she wants to purchase corn to continue growing her tortilla factory.

loans.use: purchase corn for preparing and selling tortillas.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Она Дилафруз. Ей 36 лет. Дилафруз вдова и свою дочку воспитывает одна. Ей 19 лет. Дилафруз преподаватель средней школы. Она любит детей, и каждый день помогает им во всем. Дилафруз считает, что самое светлое в жизни каждого родителя это светлое будущее их детей. Дилафруз хочет, чтобы ее дочь училась, получила высшее образование и работала по специальности. Но учительская зарплата маленькая и Дилафруз не имеет достаточной суммы денег, чтобы оплатить учебный год в Университете. Дилафруз видит, как дочка любит учиться и ее старания, поэтому Дилафруз обратилась за кредитом. Помогите Дилафтуз оплатить учебный год.
texts.en: This is Dilafruz. She is 36 and a widow and raising her 19-year-old daughter on her own. Dilafruz is a high school teacher. She loves children and helps them every day. Dilafruz believes that the most important thing in every parent's life is the bright future of their children. She wants her daughter to get a higher education and work in her field. However, her teacher's salary is small and she doesn't have enough money to pay her daughter's university tuition. Dilafruz sees how much her daughter loves to study and therefore she is requesting a loan. Please help Dilafruz pay her daughter's tuition.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Bibikalon

texts.ru: Бибикалону из Гиссара 48 лет. Она добрая, приветливая женщина и глубоко духовный человек. Бибикалон мама двоих детей. Им 21 и 23 года. Они живут с ней и помогают во всем. Бибикалон занимается животноводством. Этой деятельностью она занята уже 4 года. Животноводства является  основным источником дохода и Бибикалон держится за этот бизнес. Она просит кредит, чтобы приобрести пару голов скотин и расширить бизнес.
texts.en: Bibikalon is 48 and from the Gissar region. She is a kind and friendly woman and deeply spiritual. Bibikalon is the mother of two children aged 21 and 23. They live with her and help her with everything. Bibikalon works in animal husbandry, an occupation she has had for four years. This business is her primary source of income and she takes good care of it. She is requesting a loan to buy two head of cattle to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy two calves for fattening and resale

loans.name: Renuka

texts.en:
Renuka is a widow, 43 years old, raising her only son with love and care.  She is from the small village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri, in Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal. Her husband died a few years back, so she has to look after his business as well as her son. She is a very hardworking and courageous lady. Her son is in grade nine now. In her childhood, she did not get the opportunity to get an education due to the poor financial resources of her parents. But she is earnestly trying to provide an education to her child.

She cultivates different vegetables on her farm in different seasons and sells them to the market for her livelihood. Renuka, being a hardworking woman, works in the field after managing her all household work. With experience in agricultural work, she has been able to get ahead despite the difficulties that have risen along the way, including rising costs of inputs and the instability of the prices for buying and selling vegetables. 

As her son has grown up and the family expenses are increasing day by day, she feels likely to further improve her agricultural activities.  She has decided to cultivate paddy, which is an all-season crop, the staple food of West Bengal and in much demand throughout the year, so it will be a profitable business for her to generate income.

Currently, Renuka is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers etc. to start paddy cultivation. She has a lot of faith and hopes to get ahead because her household expenses depend on this work.

Her dream as a mother is to give a good education to her son so that he can prosper in life.  With her profits, she plans to purchase more land in the future.
 
She conveys her thanks to her lenders, BJS and Kiva, for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, bouillon cubes, oil, soap, salt, onions, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Yahuza

texts.en: Yahuza is a 28-year-old farmer from Kwankwani.  As a Babban Gona member, Yahuza is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yahuza can earn up to $2,000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags per hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yahuza is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will result in a yield of at least 60 bags of maize per hectare this season. Yahuza is hopeful about what the future holds; he hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children, Geshon and Tobi. Yahuza’s dreams do not end here. He expressed, "Ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.”

loans.use: to purchase high quality inputs in order to double his maize yield and income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy big pots, plates, chairs and food items such as rice, cooking oil, potatoes and cornmeal.

loans.name: Mallika

texts.en:
Mallika is from Dhupguri.  She is only 26 years old.  She is married and the mother of a sweet young daughter.  They live in the village of Boragari in Jalpaiguri district. She has a primary education, but her husband Sujay is illiterate and can only sign his name.

Mallika's husband has a small plot of land that he inherited from his parents.  He grows mainly paddy, which is the staple food for the local people.  So he works tirelessly with the help of his spouse to grow quality products.  He is active, diligent and hardworking. He supplies good quality products at cheaper rates.  So his customers are increasing and he wants to satisfy them.   Now he wants to grow paddy in his field.

Mallika wants to help her husband improve their business.  She came to know about BJS (Kiva's partner) and asked for a loan from them to purchase seeds and much-needed fertilizers, which impact her crop's yield.  She expects good revenue from this additional cultivation.  The increased income will soon help her to enroll her child in school. She wants to purchase more land with the profit.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for cultivation of paddy.

loans.name: Kanan

texts.en:
Kanan is only 29 years old, active, hardworking and an honest woman. Though hailing from a lower middle class family, she studied until grade 12.  Her husband Dulal, 31 years old, attended school until the 10th grade.  They are raising two young sons.  They live in their own kachha house (made of mud, bamboo and straw) in a remote region of Vemtia in Jalpaiguri district.

Kanan's husband is engaged in the small business of making detergent powder.  He purchases ingredients from the wholesale markets and makes detergent in his own house with the active help of Kanan. After making packets, he supplies his products to the local retail shops. Though this is a profitable venture, the rising cost of ingredients is withering his profit and, by extension, his savings.  He intends to expand his business by purchasing more ingredients to prepare detergents like builders, bleach, enzymes etc.  A little financial help can make his dream comes true.

Kanan has taken a loan from BJS for that purpose. She hopes to get a sustainable and stable income source for her family, which will enable her to admit her children to school.

She aspires to enhance their business for a better future. She and her husband both are thankful for their generous lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her detergent-making business.

loans.name: Rabi

texts.en: Rabi is a 35-year-old farmer from Kiyawa.  As a Babban Gona member, Rabi is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Rabi can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Rabi is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make as a Babban Gona member, her said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Joel, Daniel, and  Godiya. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Matha

texts.en: Matha is a Babban Gona farmer from Kwankwani. Matha is driven by one goal: "to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Matha to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, she finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Matha can earn up to 2,000 USD per hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Matha is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 40 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Matha will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what she plans to do with her income from this season, she said, “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.” With this loan, Matha will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: to purchase high quality inputs in order to double her maize yield and income.

loans.name: Enma Rene

texts.es: Enma se dedica a la crianza de chanchos  desde que era muy joven, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, Enma vive con su esposo, su hija y una nieta que está estudiando, Enma juntamente con su hija también se dedica a la confección de ropa, Enma va a invertir el crédito en la compra de chanchos para tenerlos en un pequeño lotecito que ella posee, Enma aspira ampliar su negocio y de esta manera salir adelante  junto a su familia.
texts.en: Enma has been raising pigs since she was very young. She is married and has 3 grown children. Enma lives with her husband, their daughter, and a granddaughter who is studying. She also make clothes together with her daughter. She is going to use this loan to buy pigs and keep them on a small lot that she owns. Enma aspires to expand her business and thus get her and her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Raquel Andrea

texts.es:
Raquel es una mujer de 24 años de edad soltera, madre de dos hijos y su negocio es la venta de ropa interior femenina.
Ella es de carácter amable y alegre, siempre está sonriéndole a la vida y se lleva muy bien con sus clientes, su trabajo es de forma ambulante porque no tiene tienda, todos los días se dirige a las diferentes ferias y mercados de la ciudad de La Paz y El Alto a ofertar sus productos.
Raquel es de tez morena y estatura baja, su cabello es de color negro al igual que sus ojos, ella necesita abastecer su negocio con mayor variedad y cantidad de ropa para competir en el mercado, también desea abrir otro negocio; la venta de productos naturales para la salud.
Es por esos motivos que Raquel solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor para competir en el mercado.
texts.en:
Raquel is a 24 year old woman, and the single mother of two children.  Her business is selling women's underwear.   She is a kind and cheerful person, always smiling at life and getting along well with her customers.  She works as a street vendor because she does not have a store.  Every day she goes to different fairs and markets in the city of La Paz and in El Alto to offer her products for sale.  Raquel is dark-skinned and short in stature; her hair is black, like her eyes.  

Raquel needs to stock her business with greater variety and a larger amount of clothing in order to compete in the marketplace.  She also wants to start another business in sale of natural products for health.  This is why Raquel is asking for a loan to buy clothing in bulk and be competitive in the marketplace.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk and be competitive in market sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more gallons of red oil to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Emidio

texts.es: A sus 73 años de edad Carlos  se dedica a la crianza de chanchos, a criar terneros y también a limpiar zapatos en la ciudad donde él reside, el vive con una sobrina y con el esposo de ella, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos  para obtener alguna ganancia, de este negocio Carlos  espera comprar más chanchitos para incrementar su negocio y cubrir sus gastos  diarios.
texts.en: At age 73, Carlos earns a living raising pigs, raising calves and also cleaning shoes in the city where he lives.   Carlos lives with his niece and her husband.  He will use the loan to buy pigs to earn some profits.  With this loan, Carlos hopes to buy more little pigs to grow his business and cover his daily costs.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 33-years-old and married with five children. With four children currently in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase additional items such as candies, soft-drinks, noodles, detergent soap, bath soap, etc. to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, soft-drinks, noodles, detergent soap, bath soap, etc. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as candies, soft-drinks, noodles, detergent soap, bath soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nyonko Do 2 Group

texts.en:
This group of five women belongs to the Nyonko Do 2 group created on January 24th, 2014. This is their first loan cycle. The group is composed of women living in one neighborhood and its surrounding area. The women get along very well. They have retail businesses in cooked food, towels, bed sheets, curtains, assorted parazone soaps, foodstuffs and cooking oil.

Vivian, the group’s star borrower, is 32 years old and has one child. She plans to continue her towel, bed sheet and curtain business, selling everyday through hawking. With the loan, she will purchase a half-bale of towels, bed sheets and curtains to sell. She will continue to use her profits to take care of her child and increase her savings.

loans.use: To purchase a half-bale of towels, bed sheets and curtains to sell

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en: Maryamu remembers the starvation her family faced during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Maryamu, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Maryamu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”, expressed Maryamu. With this loan, Maryamu is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es:
Ana de 41 años de edad, estudio a hasta 3° grado, esta soltera con 2 hijos que estudian en la Universidad uno va a 3° y el otro a 5° año, ella es encargada de darle el estudio y de cubrirle todas sus necesidades básicas.

Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la costurería y aprendió debido a que llego un proyecto a la comunidad, el cual era gratuito, ahora trabaja en la casa y sin horario establecido depende del trabajo que tenga. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar abono y fertilizantes para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y para comprar hilos, tela, y unas decoraciones. 

El sueño más cercano y primordial que tiene es que sus hijos se gradúen de sus carreras profesionales y luego que encuentren un empleo, con el negocio  es seguir trabajando para tener ingresos para la alimentación y darle la educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana, 41 years old, studied through 3rd grade.  She is single, and has two children who are studying at the University.  One is in the third year of studies and the other in the fifth year.  Ana is responsible for paying for their education and covering their basic needs.  For 20 years she has earned a living as a seamstress, learning this trade thanks to a tuition-free project that took place in her community.

Ana now works at home land without set hours; her schedule varies with the work available.   She is asking for the loan to buy manure and fertilizers for growing corn on 7,000 square meters, and to buy thread, materials and some decorations.   Her primary dream, the one closest to her heart, is that her children will graduate in their professional fields and then find work.  With the loan she will continue working to have income for food and to provide an  education to her children.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for 7,000 square meters of corn,and to buy thread, fabric and some decorations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods such as palatine, pepper etc

loans.name: Dario

texts.es: El Señor Darío, es una persona mayor, aún tiene muchas ganas de trabajar, es viudo, por diversas razones de la vida solo alcanzo a  estudiar hasta el nivel primario, vive en su casita propia de construcción rustica (adobe y calamina).  No tiene dependientes económicos a su cargo más que sus yernos que de vez en cuando están con él. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la producción agrícola, los productos que más cultiva son papa y haba en sus propias parcelas de su terreno que se encuentra ubicado en Tiraque.  El señor manifiesta ser una persona responsable y trabajadora, pero para poder seguir adelante se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono orgánico de gallinaza que mejore su producción y que a un corto plazo le permita obtener mayores ingresos económicos que vayan a mejorar sus condiciones  de vida.
texts.en: Darío is an older person who still has a desire to work. He is a widower. Because of several life reasons, he was only able to study up until elementary school. He lives in his own rustic-style house, made of adobe and corrugated iron. He doesn't have any financial dependents under his care other than his sons-in-law, who are occasionally with him. He makes a living in agricultural production. He grows potatoes and beans the most on his own plot of land, which is located in Tiraque. Darío says he is a responsible and hardworking person, but in order to keep moving forward, he sees the need to request a loan for the purchase of farming supplies, such as organic chicken manure. This will improve his production and in the short term will allow him to earn more income, which will improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Talatu Saratu

texts.en: Talatu Saratu is a 45-year-old farmer from Chiroma.  As a Babban Gona member, Talatu Saratu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Talatu Saratu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Talatu Saratu is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least  50 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Talatu Saratu is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children:  Bulus,  Nicodimus,  and  Hufre. Talatu Saratu’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he said.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Delmy Yasmin

texts.es:
Delmy de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado en la escuela, actualmente trabaja como impulsadora de ventas en una tienda, pero con una empresa de productos consumibles, donde su trabajo es ofrecer  a los clientes los productos de su empresa.

 Ella es soltera, aunque tiene 2 hijos, una hembra y un varón,  quienes asisten a la escuela, ella manifiesta que tiene siete años de trabajar en ese lugar, aunque asegura que el trabajo que hace no es bien remunerado lo sigue haciendo, pues en el país son pocas las oportunidades de empleo, el trabajo lo obtuvo con un amigo que trabajaba en el mismo lugar, también agregó que a ella siempre le a gustado trabajar en negocios, pues antes del  presente trabajo trabajó en un negocio de verduras, de su casa a su trabajo viaja a pie pues solo tiene que caminar tres minutos y ya está ahí.


El crédito lo necesita para pagar un examen médico que se hiso, que le cuesta $150.00 y para comprar  medicamentos que le recetaron, pues con el trabajo que tiene es cierto que gana, pero solo le ajusta para los gastos de ella y sus dos hijos, ella considera que si se le da este crédito se le ayudara  mucho a ella y a sus hijos, pues no tiene la posibilidad de comprar, ni pagar los exámenes, pues de invertir todo el dinero de su de un mes trabajado en los medicamentos y el examen dejaría sin alimentos a sus hijos, y siendo madre responsable no quiere hacer eso. 

Ella sueña con tener un negocio propio, que sus hijos sean profesionales y con tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Delmy is 33 years old. She studied up to Grade 9 in school. Currently she works as a sales promoter in a food store where her job is to offer the company's products to the customers. She is single and has two children, a son and a daughter who attend school. She states that she has been working for 7 years in this place and although the work is not well paid she continues to do it as there are few employment opportunities in the country. She got the job through a friend who worked in the same place. Also she adds that she always liked working in businesses. Before this job she worked in a vegetable business. She gets to work on foot as it is only a 3 minute walk there.

Delmy needs the loan to pay for a medical exam that she had that cost $150 and to pay for medication that was prescribed for her. With her job it is certain that she can make enough but she has to plan for the expenses for her and her two children. She considers that the loan will help her and her children a lot as she does not have the ability to buy what she needs and pay the examination costs. If she invested all the money from a month's wages to pay for the exam and the medication she would leave her children with no food to eat. Being a responsible mother she does not want to do that. She dreams of having her own business, that her children grow up to be professionals and to have her own house.

loans.use: to pay for a medical examination and to buy the prescribed medicine.

loans.name: Rinki

texts.en:
Rinki, a 25-year-old young lady and mother of two children (one son and one daughter), is from Dhupguri.  Her husband is a cultivator by profession. They live at Baroghoria, a small village of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Rinki has completed her education up to grade 10. Her husband attended school up to grade 12. She is a housewife who looks after her husband and her young children and manages the household.  After that, she helps her husband in his work.

Rinki's husband has his own plot of land where he has been mainly farming vegetables like potatoes, beans, eggplant, gourds etc.  He has been in this agricultural activity for the last few years. He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream of expanding his business and securing the future of the family.  With the increasing expenses of his family, he needs to increase his income by cultivating some other crop.  They have chosen paddy to cultivate, as it is the staple food for not only the people of their region but for the people throughout West Bengal. So, they hope it will be a lucrative business.

Rinki is energetic, enthusiastic and determined to make a future through hard work and cooperation.  She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase the necessary supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides so that they can start the cultivation of paddy as soon as possible. She hopes the loan will help her to raise her standard of living and to purchase more agricultural land to expand their agribusiness. She also dreams of buying a tractor for their cultivation work with the profit she will gain.

She is thankful to the generous investors (BJS and Kiva) who stand for her.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for cultivating paddy rice.

loans.name: Emmanuel Daniel

texts.en: Emmanuel Daniel remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Emmanuel Daniel, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Emmanuel Daniel  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 180 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Emmanuel Daniel.   With this loan, Emmanuel Daniel is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Malam Shuaibu

texts.en: Malam Shuaibu remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Malam Shuaibu, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Malam Shuaibu  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 20 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Malam Shuaibu.   With this loan, Malam Shuaibu is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Nestor Antonio

texts.es:
Al entrar al pequeño taller de mecánica de Néstor se nota el arduo trabajo que realiza, se dedica desde la reparación de luces hasta el pintado completo de la carrocería en mal estado.  Es un joven de 32 años que a pesar de no terminar sus estudios escolares, no se dio por vencido y busco la manera  productiva para salir adelante. Aprendió el oficio cuando trabajaba como ayudante en diferentes talleres. Día a día se levanta con mucho ánimo y energía, gracias al buen trabajo que realiza ha ganado buenos clientes. 
Para seguir en la lucha de sus metas el solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales, tales como zinc, varillas, llaves, extractores, perlines entre otros. El deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que objetivo es prosperar en la vida, quiere ser un gran empresario. Su esfuerzo por salir adelante es notorio, ya que aparte de trabajar en el taller, elabora cocinas industriales, lo que le ha generado buenos ingresos.  Uno de sus planes futuros es llegar a tener un taller más grande y con más colaboradores para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Upon entering Nestor’s small mechanics shop, one can see the hard work that he does, from repairing lights to completely refinishing auto bodies that are in poor condition. He is a young man, age 32, who in spite of not completing his schooling, did not give up, but looked for a productive way to get ahead.  He learned the trade when he worked as an assistant in different repair shops. 

Every day he gets up with a lot of enthusiasm and energy, and thanks to the good work that he does, he has earned good customers.  In order to keep fighting for his goals, he is requesting a loan. It is for the purchase of materials such as zinc, rods, wrenches, extractors, and purlins, along with other items, and he is relying on the financing. 

Because his objective is to prosper in life, he wants to be a great businessman, and his efforts to move forward stand out. Besides working in the repair shop, he makes industrial stoves, which has generated good income for him. One of his future plans is to have a bigger repair shop with more helpers in order to meet his customers’ needs.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as zinc, rods, wrenches, extractors, and purlins, along with other items.

loans.name: Usaini

texts.en: Usaini is a 37-year-old farmer from G/Mayau Rumi. As a Babban Gona member, Usaini is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Usaini can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Usaini is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Usaini said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland. In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” With this loan, Usaini is on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Joaquin Alonso

texts.es:
Joaquín, se siente satisfecho por los buenos resultados que ha tenido al utilizar créditos para seguir cultivando granos básicos (maíz, maicillo y frijoles) entre los cuales menciona mayor productividad, mejores ganancias, ha remodelado su vivienda brindándole así a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
Opta por un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de 8 sacos de abono, con lo que mejorara el desarrollo de sus cultivos y seguirá manteniendo activa su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Joaquin feels satisfied because of the good results he has had by using loans to continue harvesting basic grains (corn, sorghum and beans). The results  include more productivity and higher profits. With the loans, he also remodeled his home, which provided a better lifestyle to his family. He is requesting a new loan to invest in the purchase of 8 sacks of fertilizer, with which he will improve the development of his harvests and will maintain his source of income active.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a 30-year- old farmer from G/Bako Rumi. As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yahaya can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Yahaya is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Yahaya said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; Yuwana,   Linas, and  Salama, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: El señor Orlando, tiene 40 años de edad trabaja como Sociólogo en proyectos rurales y vive en Quillacollo, con lo que ha podido ahorrar con su trabajo,  se compro un terreno hace más de un año y poco a poco ha construido una habitación, antes siempre vivió en alquiler, trasladándose de una zona a otra, a la fecha termino de construir una habitación con su baño  pero necesita comprar un tanque para almacenar agua y construir una lavandería, haciendo una conexión con tuberías a las mismas, como le falto recursos y quiere terminar la obra para vivir en condiciones más dignas, solicita un credito ya que la zona no tiene agua y tiene que comprar de la cisterna, por eso necesita un tanque de almacenamiento.
texts.en: Orlando is 40 years old and works as a sociologist in rural projects. He lives in Quillacollo and with the savings from his work, he bought a piece of land over a year ago. He has slowly built a house. Before, he always lived in rented homes, moving from one area to another. He has so far built a living area and bathroom, but needs to buy a tank to store water, build a laundry room and connect the two with pipes. He is requesting a loan as he lacks resources and wants to finish the construction to be able to live in decent conditions. The region where he lives does not have water and he has to buy the tank to store water.

loans.use: to buy a tank to store water and to build a laundry room.

loans.name: Ma. Cenisa

texts.en:
Ma. Cenisa is married and works hard to support her family. She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines for eleven years.

Ma. Cenisa requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Ma. Cenisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vimbai

texts.en: Vimbai is a 24-year-old from the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She is married and has a child. Vimbai became a matemba vendor, who moved from village to village, three years ago but now has her shop in a rented space. She supplies rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, and snacks to her community. As a Camfed Learner Guide, Vimbai volunteers each week at the local secondary school as a teacher of life skills. Vimbai plans to use the loan to build her own shop building so that she will no longer have to pay rent. Her hope is to be able to have a stable income that can support her family.

loans.use: to build a building for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy red oil to sell.

loans.name: José Pablo

texts.es:
José de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta 1º grado, y no pudo continuar ya que no tenía el apoyo económico de la familia,  está soltero y vive con su abuela y abuelo.

José se ha dedicado toda la  vida en la agricultura en la siembra de granos básicos, además hace trabajos del día en el corral o chapodar, piensa sembrar 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz a unos 15 minutos de su hogar y se va caminando. 

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar abono y veneno para combatir las plagas y además combatir el monte. 

Espera que su cultivo se desarrolle sin problemas para tener una buena cosecha, con los ingresos lo que hará es invertir para la próxima cosecha y pagar la deuda que contrajo.
texts.en: José is 23 years old, and studied up to first grade, although he wasn't able to continue his studies as his family were unable to support him financially. He is single and lives with his grandparents. José has been a farmer his whole life, planting basic staple foods. He also works during the day on the ranch or pruning. He is planning to plant 10,500 square metres of corn 15 minutes from his house, which he can reach on foot. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase fertiliser and pesticide to combat pests and to kill weeds. He hopes that his crop will grow without any problems and that he will have a good harvest. He will then use the income to invest in the next harvest and pay the debt he contracted.

loans.use: to purchase fertiliser and pesticides to combat pests and to kill weeds.

loans.name: Na'omi

texts.en: Na'omi remembers not being able to feed her family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Na'omi, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Na'omi  is ambitious and is aiming to reap over 30 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Na'omi.  With this loan, Na'omi is well on her way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, a 30-year-old mother from the Wedza District of Zimbabwe, is focused on providing for her children. For work, she runs a mobile business selling shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, T-shirts, and even cosmetics. Joyce also takes the time to volunteer in her community. She is a Camfed Learner Guide and teaches life skills education in the local schools as a way to enhance the young students’ learning environment. 

With the loan, Joyce will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, T-shirts and cosmetics to increase her supplies and therefore increase sales. Joyce would like to have a better life and open her own clothing shop one day.

loans.use: To purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, T-shirts and cosmetics to increase her supplies and therefore increase sales.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, está estudiando la carrera de derecho, y comenta que de aquí en un año se ve como una profesional recibida, lo cual pudo lograr con la ayuda de su familia.
Comenta que es madre, y que con su rol de estudiante es un poco difícil, pero que lo está logrando con la ayuda de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad para poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Tomasa is from the city of Ybycuí and is studying for a degree in Law. She says that she expects to become a professional within a year, which will enable her to help her family.

Tomasa says that she is a mother, so the role of student is a bit difficult. However, she has the help of her loved ones. She is requesting a loan in order to pay the university fees so that she can keep studying.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase grocery produce

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara is a 50-year-old farmer from Kiyawa.  As a Babban Gona member, Hajara, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Hajara can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Hajara is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season with the high quality inputs she will obtain as a result of this loan. When asked how she plans to use her expected income at the end of the season, Hajara said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Ussaini, Hassana, and Asama'u, and ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a 55-year-old farmer from Kiyawa.  As a Babban Gona member, Haruna is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Haruna can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Haruna is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 30-year old mother of four in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She is a dedicated campaigner for the economic independence of all young women in her community. Grace is also a Camfed volunteer Learner Guide who teaches life skills at the local secondary school. Additionally, Grace started her own business. She buys and sells grocery items such as sugar, cooking oil, soap, stationary, candles, flour, milk, juice, salt, and mealie-meal (ground maize). This Kiva loan will enable Grace to expand her business by increasing her stock and raising her sales. She hopes to build her own shop in the community and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to expand her business by increasing her stock and raising her sales.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 37-year-old widow with five children. She lives in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe, and operates a fruit and vegetable stall at the local business center. She sells apples, bananas, oranges, cabbages, and tomatoes. Grace started the business four years ago after receiving a grant from Camfed. She is very proud of the growth that she has achieved so far. In addition to her business endeavors, Grace leads weekly counselling sessions to students as a Camfed Learner Guide . She is also very encouraging of other young women in the community who wish to start their own businesses. Grace will use the Kiva loan to buy apples, bananas, oranges, cabbages, and tomatoes for the current stall and would like to open another stall, as well.

loans.use: To buy apples, bananas, oranges, cabbages, and tomatoes for the current stall and she would also like to open another stall.

loans.name: Kyanyambali Klezia Group

texts.en: Mary is a married woman with four children and lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She operates a retail shop selling general merchandise which she started with capital from savings in this group, and from group loans. She obtains additional income from farming. She experiences low capital to buy her products, accompanied by price fluctuations, and her vision is to be economically well off with proceeds from her business.  Mary needs the loan to add sugar and soap in the business to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and soap to sell in her business.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Guillermina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de globos y galletas, venta de mantas, venta de quinua y ropa, tejido de mantas, venta de comida, venta de alfombras, servicio de transporte.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Guillermina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pesque (comida hecha con quinua); da a conocer que este negocio lo inicia hace varios años, aprendiendo la elaboración del producto de su madre, cuando tuvo su pareja decide implementar este arte culinario como generación de recursos económicos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para alimento en tiempo de sequía (compra de quinua por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de su comunidad y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen una de las clientes no esta presente, ya que tuvo que viajar de imprevisto.
texts.en:
The group Virgen de Guadalupe will begin its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Focus Centre. The group is made up of nine members and is directed by a board where Guillermina is the President. The businesses that the members have are varied, among them are: milk sales, the sale of cookies and balloons, the sale of quinoa and clothes, blanket weaving, food sales, carpet sales, and transportation services.

The loan that is being requested will benefit small entrepreneurs where Guillermina is a member. She mentions that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer, she joined because of an invitation from a client of the institution that went to visit her in her home. Currently she has a business selling "pesque" (a food made of quinoa); she indicated that she started this business many years ago. She learned how to make the dish from her mother, and when she got married she decided to use this culinary art as a way to make money.

The requested loan is to buy quinoa at wholesale. She will purchase it from the salespeople in her community and then use it in her business for her sales. This work allows her to generate the means to support her family, as she lives in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she stated that she likes the life assurance the institution offers.

One of the members is not pictured in the photo because she has to travel all of a sudden.

loans.use: to buy quinoa at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy enough food and gallon oil, rice, plantains etc to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make bulk purchases of poultry to meet the demands of the community.

loans.name: Mosoqllancay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOSOQLLANCAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quillabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rupertina ella es soltera y tiene 76 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.



Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Mosoqllancay” which is located in the District of Quillabamba in La Convención, Department of Cusco.

Rupertina is 76 years old, single, and has four children. She works at her grocery business where she sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil. Rupertina works from 8:00 A.M. to 10:00 P.M. She has been in this business for five years and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery business. She is requesting a loan to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

The other members have businesses that involve agriculture, selling animals, selling groceries, and selling food.

Rupertina is grateful to those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Dismas

texts.en: Dismas is a twenty-five year old man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a hardworking man dealing in poultry.  He buys and sells chicken, eggs, and chicks. He earns additional income from a salary. He began the business to generate income for meeting his personal needs as his vision is to build a commercial house. He is faced with the challenge of price fluctuations for his business, plus poultry diseases. Dismas needs a loan to buy layers for egg production.

loans.use: to buy layers for egg production.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet is a mother of 8 children and lives in Kyenjojo Uganda. She is a responsible mother and works hard maintaining the welfare of her people. She has a retail shop business and is also a cattle keeper. School fees can never be met on time for without any financial support and that’s why as a parent, Violet found it necessary to seek credit to enable her to ease the burden. She intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is married man with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a farmer who grows maize for sale, and has been doing so for the past twenty years in the rural areas. He began the business to generate income to meet his family’s basic needs of food, security, shelter, and education. His hopes are completing his residential home, and building a commercial house. Though he has to face challenging weather changes as he does not have irrigation in case of a dry season. William is requesting a loan to complete his commercial building.

loans.use: to complete his commercial building.

loans.name: Audu Malam

texts.en: Audu Malam is a Babban Gona farmer from Furana. Audu Malam is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Audu Malam to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Audu Malam can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare - double the national average of 14. However, Audu Malam is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 100 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access the required yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Audu Malam is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.  Ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Audu Malam will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Bainomugisa Group

texts.en:
Sharon is operating a drug shop. She is a hardworking Ugandan woman who also does farming to earn a living. Sharon desires to grow her business, but she is challenged by competition from government hospitals that offer free services. However, she is getting credit to buy drugs for selling. 

She is a member of Bainomugisa Group, where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy drugs for selling

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 29-year-old married man with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. When Wilson realized that farming could not raise enough for his family's basic needs, he used his small savings from cocoa to start a butcher shop to increase his household income. He can now afford to send all his children to school and maintain the welfare of his home. He dreams of expanding his business, though limited capital affects him.

Wilson is requesting a loan to buy cows for meat to sell.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughtering to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: by buying more cassava and pepper to sell.

loans.name: Katooke Kwekamba Group

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with four children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She operates a retail market stall selling soap, stationery, sugar, salt and household goods, which she started to be financially okay with capital from savings in their group and group loans. She obtains additional income from millet and sugar canes. She experiences low capital to buy her products, and price fluctuations, yet her vision is to be economically well off with proceeds from her business. 

Esther needs the loan to add more stock like cooking oil, rice and bread to sell.

loans.use: to add more stock like cooking oil, rice and bread to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sewing a machine and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an oversewing machine and sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his sister's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his brother's school expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an oversewing machine, generator and sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an air compressor and oil and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and iron.

loans.name: Canela Group

texts.es: Maritza: Es una joven sonriente, amable de 24 años de edad, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, casada,  tiene 1 hijo de 7 años de edad,  es la coordinadora del grupo solidario. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 14 años estableció su pequeño negocio de chivería, pan, granos básicos y pescado. Solicita su primer financiamiento para  comprar mercadería. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero y construir su vivienda de concreto.
texts.en:
Maritza, age 24, is a friendly smiling young woman who is originally from Puerto Cabezas. She is married and has a seven-year-old child. Martiza is the coordinator of her solidarity group.

With the intent of having her own source of income, she established a small business selling yogurt, bread, basic grains, and fish 14 years ago. She is requesting her first loan in order to buy merchandise. Her dream is to have a prosperous business and to build a concrete house.

loans.use: to buy fish, yogurt, and basic grains to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a face massage machine and chair and to renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, generator and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, table and generator.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 43 years old and married. With three children who are in school, Delia works very hard to provide for them.

Delia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 28,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. And she earns additional income from food vending.

Delia has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Delia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, table and iron.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products and a freezer and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Sunilda

texts.es:
Sunilda se esta esforzando arduamente para poder recibirse, quiere luchar y conseguir su meta de ser una profesional de ayuda a las demás personas que lo necesitan. Ella comenta que su préstamo anterior lo usó para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus clases y su cuota.
Hoy pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, ya que está por terminar su carrera y quiere poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Sunilda is working hard so that she can graduate. She wants to keep striving toward her goal of becoming a professional who can help other people in need. Sunilda says that her previous loan was invested in her classes and fees.

Today she is applying for another loan so that she can cover her degree expenses. Since she is nearing the end of her degree program, she wants to be able to cover these outstanding expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her degree expenses.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Allan works hard to support his family.

He has a smoked fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling pearl. Allan is borrowing 26,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more fish to make smoked fish for his smoked fish vending business.

Allan has been sustaining his business activities through his past 11 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make smoked fish

loans.name: José Esteban

texts.es:
Son las 5 de la mañana, el amanecer va cubriendo lentamente las parcelas de trigo y ayote de José, un agricultor quien a sus 41 años es agricultor desde hace un poco más de dos décadas. Con solo sexto grado de primaria aprobado, debido a la falta de dinero, ha podido avanzar profesionalmente. Tiene dos personas de las cuales se motiva y se hace cargo, su hija de 7 años, quien emocionada asiste al colegio, y su pareja, quien lo apoya en todo lo que necesita. 
Este emprendedor tuvo que migrar a Costa Rica para poder iniciar con su sueño, pues consiguió trabajo, el cual sirvió como ahorro para poder comprar un motor de riego y tuberías para iniciar a sembrar con un poco de maíz, pipian y ayote. Afortunadamente tiene el apoyo de su hermano, pero no tiene otro ingreso económico, por esta razón necesita de un préstamo para comprar abono, pagar mano de obra para arar el terreno y comprar combustible para el motor de riego, que le permitirán tener un buen desarrollo en la siembra de trigo. En un futuro piensa comprar dos vacas, para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
At 5:00 A.M., the dawn begins to cover the plots of wheat and squash that José has planted. He is a 41-year-old farmer who has been doing this type of work for a little more than two decades. Even though he only has a sixth grade education, which was due to a lack of money, José was able to advance professionally. There are two people under his care who motivate him: his seven-year-old daughter who is excited about attending school and his partner who helps him with everything he needs.

This entrepreneur had to migrate to Costa Rica in order to start his dream. He was able to secure work, which allowed him to save money toward the purchase of a motor and irrigation pipes so that he could begin planting some corn, pumpkins, and squash. José fortunately has the support of his brother since he has no other income. For this reason, he needs a loan in order to buy compost, pay for labor in order to plow the land, and purchase fuel for the motor of his irrigation pump. This will allow his plot of wheat to develop well. In the future, he plans to buy two cows so that he can keep growing.

loans.use: to buy compost, pay for labor, and purchase fuel for the motor of his irrigation pump.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 44 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of pearls business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of pearl to sell.

Lucy has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of pearls business for six years and earns additional income from fishing.

Lucy aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of pearls to sell

loans.name: Las Águilas Group

texts.es: Manuela tiene 39 años de edad (aparece en la foto de segundo de la fila de atrás, de izquierda a derecha, viste güipil color morado), tiene 8 hijos, uno es mayor de edad trabaja en el centro de salud de la comunidad y 7 son estudiantes, ella obtiene sus ingresos en la elaboración y venta de ropa típica (cortes, güipiles, fajas) , la necesidad de apoyar a sus hijos en su educación la hizo iniciar este negocio desde hace 20 años, actividad muy rentable ya es lo que visten todas las mujeres de la comunidad donde vive, también sale a vender en las comunidades cercanas, Manuela necesita un crédito para comprar materia prima (hijos de diferentes colores)  para la elaboración de ropa típica, la meta de Manuela es que todos sus hijos se gradúen de alguna profesión y que cada uno tenga su propia casa.
texts.en:
Manuela is 39 years old. In the photo, she is the second person in the back row, wearing a purple blouse. She has eight children. Her oldest child is an adult and is working at a community health center. The remaining seven children are students.

Manuela earns her income by making and selling traditional clothes (skirts, dresses, and sashes). She started this business 20 years ago because she needed to support her children’s education. Her business is very profitable since all of the women in her community are seen wearing these types of clothes. In addition, she sells in the neighboring communities.

Manuela needs a loan in order to buy supplies (thread in different colors) for making traditional clothes. Her goal is for all of her children to graduate and pursue some type of profession so that they can have homes of their own.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making traditional clothes.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati, 27, lives with her family in the small village of Kathapara in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Her family consists of her husband Tapan and one son. Her son is too small now to go to school.  Minati studied up to grade nine and could not continue her studies due to her parental poverty.  Her husband has a sixth grade education. 

Minati's husband is a cultivator by profession. Minati is also engaged in this agribusiness.  She assists her husband in his field work. However, since her kid is too young, she also has to look after him.
  
Minati and her husband have decided to cultivate cucumbers on their farmland. Cucumbers are in great demand in the market.  Minati wants to help her husband in his agricultural activities to generate more income but they need financial help to buy agricultural supplies.

Minati heard that BJS (Kiva's partner) gives business loans to rural women and she has taken a loan from them to purchase agricultural supplies such as cucumber seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. She wants to use the profit generated from this business to manage her family expenses, to bear the expenses of raising her child and to save a little amount to make a concrete house for them in the future.

She is thankful for her generous lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies like seeds and  fertilizers to grow cucumbers.

loans.name: Marcelo Gerardo

texts.es:
Marcelo es un hombre de 27 años de edad soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es la cerrajería.
Él es un hombre joven de tez morena estatura mediana y cabello negro, su trabajo lo realiza en la ciudad de ‘El Alto’ distante a 30 minutos de la ciudad capital.
Marcelo es de carácter alegre, siempre está riendo y haciendo chistes a sus clientes, el humor que tiene se refleja en su trabajo, ya que sus clientes regresan por el buen trato que reciben.
Él necesita la ampliación de su negocio; realizando la compra de fierros por mayor para diversificar su actividad y generar nuevos ingresos, también tiene ideas para nuevos emprendimientos.
Es por esos motivos que Marcelo solicita un préstamo para la compra de fierros por mayor y así ampliar su cerrajería.
texts.en:
Marcelo is a 27-year-old man who is single and has no children. His business is a metal shop. This young man has a tan complexion, medium stature, and black hair. He conducts his work in the city of El Alto, which is 30 minutes from the capital.

Marcelo is a cheerful character who is always laughing and making jokes with his customers. His humor is reflected in his work since his customers return because of the good service they receive.

Marcelo needs to expand his business. By purchasing metal at wholesale, he can diversify his business and generate additional income. He also has ideas for new ventures. For this reason, Marcelo is requesting a loan so that he can buy metal at wholesale and expand his metal shop.

loans.use: to buy metal at wholesale so that he can expand his business.

loans.name: Kitchy

texts.en:
Kitchy is 31 years old and married with two children who are in school. Kitchy works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell ready-to-wear goods in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Kitchy has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future Kitchy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear goods to sell.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es de la ciudad de San Pedro, está estudiando la carrera de derecho y Ciencias. Comenta que por medio de sus estudios quiere poder ayudar a su familia.
Oscar es una persona que se está esforzando por poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar su matrícula, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Oscar is from the city of San Pedro and is studying for a degree in Law and Sciences. He says that through his studies, he wants to be able to help his family.

Oscar is a person who is striving to grow and move forward. He is requesting a loan so that he can pay for his registration fees. This will enable him to keep striving toward his goals.

loans.use: to pay his registration fees.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 37 years old and married with four children.  With three of her children in school, Catherine works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, canned goods, charcoal, eggs, etc.

Catherine has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Catherine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, canned goods, charcoal and eggs

loans.name: Predismenda

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Predismenda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income as a fishpond operator.  Predismenda is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Predismenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, and shampoo

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 37 years old and married with four children who are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jonah is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

Jonah has been raising pigs for one year and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Ana

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Ma. Ana works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Ma. Ana is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ma. Ana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 61 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Alicia has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and earns additional income from boarding house rental.

Alicia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Imelda is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a repair shop business in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional spare parts and other materials for her business.

Imelda has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts and other materials for her business

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 26 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Erma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Erma has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Erma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 35 years old and married with three children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Christine has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from food vending.

Christine aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu is a 30-year-old farmer from Hayin Malam Yako.  As a Babban Gona member, Adamu, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Adamu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Adamu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Adamu said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Kamal, Buhari,and Uzairu, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia is 47 years old and married with four children.  With two children in school, Hermenia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Hermenia has been in this business for four years. 

In the future, Hermenia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo is 47 years old and single. He works very hard to help his parents.

He runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Leo has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Leo would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario, con la ayuda que Kiva le brindo por medio del crédito anterior se ha mantenido trabajando en la agricultura y generando ingresos con los que cubre las necesidades de su familia.
Don Mario requiere un nuevo préstamo para comprar abono, semilla, fertilizantes, plaguicidas e insecticidas, espera tener mayor productividad y mejores ganancias con las que cubrirá la nueva deuda. Su familia se mantiene en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
With the help of the previous loan he received from Kiva, Mario was able to continue working in agriculture and generate income to cover his family’s needs.

Don Mario is requesting a new loan so that he can buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, fungicides, and insecticides. He hopes to have greater productivity and better earnings, which he will use to repay this new debt. His family is living under optimal conditions.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, fungicides, and insecticides.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Shehu Juda

texts.en: Shehu Juda is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Shehu Juda joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Aminu,Isuzu, and Zainab. Shehu Juda is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Shehu Juda will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Shehu Juda can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to build a better home.” Shehu Juda is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 44 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Gina has borrowed and repaid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from food vending and selling vegetables.

Gina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella works hard to support her family. Bella is married and has a repair shop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her shop.

Bella has been in this business for three years now.

In the future Bella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her repair shop.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Llena Group

texts.es: Ana Patricia tiene 38 años de edad, es madre de dos adolescentes y un niño menor de edad, ella solo se ha encargado de brindarle a sus hijos una correcta condición de vida, paga la universidad de su hijo mayor, cursos de inglés para su hija ya que no le alcanza el dinero para poder pagarle a ella una carrera universitaria, su hijo menor es estudiante de primaria, los tres como estudiantes de honor en la institución. Esto lo ha logrado doña Ana gracias a su actividad como comerciante, en el barrio donde vive cuenta con una tienda de ropa para todo público donde le ayuda su hija; para que ella pueda vender de manera ambulante los artículos que le solicitan los diferentes clientes. Ella solicita este crédito para invertir en la compra de mercadería especialmente para el día de la madre donde asegura que las ventas aumentan, especialmente en el caso de ella que ofrece diversidad de productos femeninos. Con estas ganancias ella logra continuar pagando la educación de sus hijos, alimentación y gastos básicos. Su mayor sueños es ver a sus hijos graduarse de la Universidad ya que ella no tuvo la posibilidad de estudiar. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la baja tasa de interés y atención personalizada.
texts.en: Ana Patricia is 38 years old. She is mother to two teenagers and a young boy, and she alone is in charge of providing the children with proper living conditions.
