She pays for her eldest son's university studies, as well as English classes for her daughter because she doesn't have enough for her university tuition too. Her youngest son is in elementary school, and all three children are honor-roll students. Ana has been able to achieve this thanks to her work as a merchant. She has a neighborhood clothing store for all kinds of people, and her children help her so she can go out to sell the articles her different customers desire. Ana is requesting this loan to invest in merchandise, especially for Mother's Day, when she is certain her sales will increase since she offers a variety of women's products. With the earnings, she will be able to continue paying for her children's education, food and basic expenses. Her biggest dream is to see her children graduate from college, since she never had the chance herself. She chose Kiva partner Fundación Mujer for the low interest rate and the personalized attention.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for her neighborhood store.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Doña Florinda, de 30 años casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo se dedica a hacer fletes es dueño de su propio negocio,  de sus dos hijas una estudia primaria. Doña Florinda se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, como maíz y frijol pero su venta mayor y diaria es el frijol negro ya que vende por gran cantidad, en los meses anteriores puso otra venta al lado de la suya, venta de juguetes. Lleva ya doce años vendiendo y eso implica que la gente la busque y la conozca por vender producto de calidad.  Su meta siempre a sido darles un patrimonio a sus hijas y es el estudio.
texts.en:
Doña Florinda is 30 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband has his own cargo shipping business. They have two daughters, one of whom is in primary school.

Doña Florinda sells basic staples, such as corn and beans. Among her best selling products are black beans, of which she is able to sell in large quantities. A few months ago, she set up another business selling toys. Florinda has been in retail for 12 years, which means that people look for her and know that she sells quality products.

Her goal has always been to leave a legacy for her daughters, which is to provide them an education.

loans.use: to buy beans in bulk quantities.

loans.name: Milany

texts.en: Milany works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell live crabs business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional live crabs to sell. She has been in this business for nine years now. In the future, Milany would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional live crabs to sell.

loans.name: Ibro

texts.en: Ibro is a 38-year-old farmer from Hayin Malam Yaro.  As a Babban Gona member, Ibro is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ibro can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ibro is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 per hectare this season. When asked, Ibro said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children, and in 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Neris Antonia

texts.es:
La disciplina, la voluntad y la constancia son características esenciales de doña Neris, una señora amable y trabajadora de 42 años,  quién poco a poco ha progresado de hace quince años en el negocio de venta de ropa usada. Su inventario ha aumentado así como su clientela, lo que le ha generado buenas ganancias y de esta manera ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida.
Es una mujer con grandes sueños y metas por cumplir, por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de ropa tanto para niños como para adultos, al mismo tiempo de zapatos. Uno de sus cuatro hijos, es quien le ha ayudado directamente en el negocio, gracias a su hijo y al financiamiento se siente motivada en seguir progresando. Una de sus metas es acondicionar mejor su hogar y establecer otro local para cumplir la demanda de sus clientes. Anhela seguir invirtiendo y prosperando.
texts.en: Discipline, will and perseverance are essential characteristics of Neris, a friendly and hardworking woman of 42 who little by little has made progress after starting to sell used clothing 15 years ago. Her inventory has increased along with her clientele, which has allowed her to earn good profits and improve her living conditions. She is a woman with big dreams and goals to fulfill, which is why she is requesting a loan to purchase clothing for adults and children, as well as shoes. One of her four children directly helps her with the business, and thanks to this son and the financing she is receiving she feels motivated to continue making progress. One of her goals is to improve the condition of her home and establish another sales point to meet the demands of her customers. Neris aims to continue investing and prospering.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for adults and children alike, as well as shoes.

loans.name: Dúo Alejandra De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Dúo Alejandra de Vista Hermosa la encargada de este dúo es la señora Miriam Alejandra quien se dedica a la venta de ropa típica desde hace 3 años, es vendedora ambulante y viviendo al lado de su esposo le agradece a Dios porque cada día el negocio sigue creciendo.  Tiene varios pedidos de güipiles típicos en diferentes colores,  calidad y precios pero no le alcanza el dinero que tiene, por tal motivo necesita hacer otro préstamo para poder comprar los güipiles que le hacen falta y así no quedarles mal a las personas que  confían en ella.  Su sueño es tener una gran venta de ropa típica y dejar de ser vendedora ambulante.
texts.en: The woman in charge of this tandem is Miriam Alejandra, who has made a living selling traditional clothes for the past three years. She is a street vendor and lives alongside her husband. She thanks God because every day her business keeps growing. She has a number of orders for traditional blouses of different colors, qualities and prices, but she does not have the necessary funds to acquire them, which is why she is requesting another loan so she can purchase the blouses and thus not disappoint the people who are relying on her. Her dream is to have a big clothing store and stop being a street vendor.

loans.use: to purchase traditional clothes to sell.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en: Sheila is 38 years old and single. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Sheila has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nelia has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from tailoring. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

Cecelia has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from selling vegetables. She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish to make dried fish for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Maria

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her bag weaving business. Maria has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from food vending. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Alma works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more fish for her dried fish making business.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 64 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like soap, shampoo, egg, sugar, coffee, etc to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock like soap, shampoo, egg, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is 35 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Sheryl has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Sheryl aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Misael

texts.es:
El señor Misael es un veterano de mil batallas vividas a lo largo de su vida y vive en el municipio de El Santuario.
El es un hombre muy trabajador y desde hace algún tiempo viene trabajando en el negocio de la venta de mercancías variadas como relojes, parlantes, entre otros. Su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de estas mercancías. 
El ofrece sus productos en un pequeño puesto ubicado en las puertas de un almacén, desde allí atiende a sus clientes de una manera muy cordial.
Manifiesta que es un negocio muy lucrativo y sencillo de realizar para su edad.
El solicita un préstamo para compra de surtido para abastecer su negocio y generar unos mejores ingresos.
El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de capitalizar su negocio y de darle un impulso considerable a su actividad, permitiéndole obtener recursos para su supervivencia.
texts.en:
Misael is a veteran of a thousand battles lived during the length of his life and he lives in the city of El Santuario.  

He is a hard working man and for the last while has been working in a business selling varied merchandise such as watches, speakers, and other items.  His business consists of buying and selling this merchandise.  

He sells his products in a small stall located at the entrance of a mall, and there he waits on his customers in a very cordial manner.  He notes that it is a lucrative business and simple to run at his age.  

He is asking for a loan in order to purchase inventory and supply his business in order to generate better income.  

This loan will give him the opportunity to capitalize his business and to give his economic activity a considerable boost, allowing him to obtain resources for survival.

loans.use: To supply his watch and speaker business.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of one child, Leonidas works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell fruits business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Leonidas is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of fruits to sell for her buy and sell fruits business.

Leonidas has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 39 years old and has three children. Aileen is a widow and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming bananas in the Philippines. Aileen requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other supplies.

Aileen has been farming bananas for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Aileen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other supplies.

loans.name: Baby Jane

texts.en:
Baby Jane works hard to support her family. Baby Jane has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like fishing nets, iceboxes, etc. needed for her business.

Baby Jane has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like fishing nets, iceboxes, etc. needed for her business.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 50 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Milagros has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 39-year-old married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jennifer requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase gasoline, fishing nets, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jennifer has been in this business for 7 years.  In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, fishing nets, etc

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
Estella, who is 41 years old, is happy tending her little store.  She is married with two kids, and her husband is a farmer. The store is her means of earning a living to support her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales.  

Estella keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores.   Estella believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Estella has reached her 4th year being a member of Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. 

She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and and also afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetable oil, charcoal and yams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks and groundnut oil.

loans.name: Dunda Mu Yesu Group

texts.fr: Balume est commerçante, dynamique, entrepreneur depuis 7 ans est membre d’une Association d’Affaires «Dunda mu Yesu», âgée de 27 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants, qui tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse de braises dans les artères de la ville. Elle étale ses activités dans un dépôt tout au long de la route. Son conjoint, lui aussi est commerçant. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 15 sacs de braises. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds  reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir  ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Balume has been a dynamic trader and entrepreneur for the past seven years and is also a member of the "Dunda mu Yesu" business association. She is 27 years old, married and mother to two children, who are both at school. She sells charcoal in the town's main roads. She lays out her products on a counter which stretches all along the road. Her husband is also a trader. She is requesting a loan from Hekima so that she can expand her business. She is going to buy 15 sacks of charcoal. She began her business with funds she received from her husband. In the future she would like to build up her capital, buy a plot of land, and educate and feed her children. She is grateful to Hekima for its support of female entrepreneurs who are unable to access banks, by giving them loans during this post-conflict period in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie works hard to support her family. Margie is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net.

Margie has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Margie would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Merle-Lyn

texts.en:
Merle-lyn runs a water refilling business as an aid to her husband's income from employment as an overseas worker. 

She has been in this business for more than six years, earning well to provide some of the needs of her three children. She had successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used for materials needed in her business.  She was determined to improve her business to gain more returns from it. 

She took a new loan recently, to buy more raw materials for water refilling. 

In the future, Merle-lyn wants to have better living conditions for her entire family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for water refilling

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina works hard to support her family. Valentina is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables, etc.

Valentina has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Valentina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables, etc. for her restaurant.

loans.name: Sherwin

texts.en:
Sherwin studied automotive at EMCOTECH (Eastern Mindanao College of Technology). He wants to have a stable job in the future. 

Sherwin joined GDMPC and he gains access to microfinance services. He borrowed a loan to pay his school tuition fee for the 1st semester. 

Hoping to secure his future, he is determined and always thinks positive things in order to study well.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fee for the 1st semester

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 26 years old, married, and living in Simacolong, Lazi, Siquijor, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she does hog raising and sells them commercially. 

Paglaum has supported the purchase of her original piglets & feed. Now, she requests a loan of 14,900 PHP to buy bags of feed. Mary Grace really hopes & prays that her business will grow and benefit her family. Someday, she wants to have their house renovated with good roofing and fencing.

loans.use: to buy bags of feed

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 45 years old and married with three children.

Mary Jean works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like rice, snack foods, and other groceries.

Mary Jean has borrowed and repaid eleven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Mary Jean aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, snack foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Imee

texts.en: Imee operates a general store to make a living.  She has been running the business for two years, and she earns well to support the needs of her family.  She has requested a loan from GDMPC to purchase more grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Nolibeth

texts.en:
Nolibeth works hard to support her family. Nolibeth is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a loan of PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business such as fishing nets and an icebox.

Nolibeth has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Nolibeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fishing nets and an icebox for her business

loans.name: Emely

texts.en: Emely has been operating her own retail store for more than three years and she earns well from this.  Having a family means that she needs to make more efforts to provide for their needs, especially her two children. She works hard with determination of having better income to provide her children with a better education.  To improve sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional goods to sell. In the future, Emely hopes to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her general store

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 37-year-old married man. He settled to earn his living in Oroquieta City, Philippines together with his two children. Over fourteen years, Francis was able to manage his business to meet the needs of his family. Until now, it is still doing well and is giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. With his generated revenue, he was able to save for their future needs. Recently, he took a new loan to buy additional chest foam (polystyrene boxes). He expects an increase in sales so as to improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional chest foam (polystyrene boxes)

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela has the ability to make a variety of snacks, which she sells to earn an income. 

As a Microfinance Member of Paglaum MPC, she applied a loan for the needed capitalization. This inspires Adela to be extra careful in her business and she wants to expand by increasing her inventory. 

Recently, she applied for another loan to purchase raw ingredients for snack vending. Adela hopes to sustain her business and wishes to maintain her status as a member in good standing with the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is 44 years old, married, and a resident of Siquijor. Her husband is a tricycle driver.

Starting with a capitalization of 2,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari store (convenience store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoy the benefit given by the co-op.  

Now she is applying for 25,000 PHP to buy a motor sidecar for added income. Edwina deeply wishes to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy a motor sidecar
